programme.title: Couples Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: In Newcastle, three rival couples battle it out to host the best dinner party. Partners Fiona and Hannah kick things off with their Moroccan-themed menu. Couple David and Sonia, and childhood sweethearts Claire and Steven, all agree the puppet show was unexpected. Day two sees Steven and Claire's German-inspired menu. Finally, David decides a charm offensive is needed for his and Sonia's night.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: At Nikolas Patrick pawnbrokers in Kent, brothers Charlie and Patrick receive an Olympic torch that the owner wants £10,000 for, as well as some designer bags and a collection of antique firearms. Love is in the air for a newly engaged couple in Sheffield, and some rare footwear comes in.(n)

programme.title: Posh Pawnbrokers
programme.desc: In Sheffield, pawnbroker Dan at London Road is faced with a collection of crystals that owners Lynette and David want big money for. At Nikolas Patrick in Kent, brothers Charlie and Patrick run aground while testing a speedboat, and Sophie wants instant cash for her diamante-covered Jimmy Choo shoes.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Phil Spencer catches up with Mel and Jon, who had their hearts set on owning a piece of the Herefordshire countryside, while Kirstie Allsopp revisits outdoor sports enthusiasts Liz and John, a year after helping them find a property to suit their needs in Derby.(n)

programme.title: Best of Both Worlds
programme.desc: Lucy Alexander helps two sets of house hunters, including Maddie and Nick in Hampshire, who are looking to find a home that feels rural while offering a bit of cafe culture.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: As the B&B owners meet for the final time, Paul Martin and Jayne Kirk from The Forest Country House want to get to the bottom of Nadia's low scores.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Personal trainer Eve Booth hosts the first dinner party in Co Durham and Wearside, expressing concern that her starter of haggis and black pudding may not be to everyone's taste. Although her main course gets a lukewarm reception, the biggest threat to the evening seems to be fellow contestant Ken Brown's taste in jokes.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Interior designer and gypsy wedding supplier Paula Thompson hosts the second party in Co Durham and Wearside, and hopes to bring a touch of class to the proceedings with her `black and bling' themed event. The evening's menu includes fresh lobster and hairy prawns, accompanied by a spot of belly dancing.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Nineteen-year-old languages student Donal Anand-Shaw hosts the third dinner party in Co Durham and Wearside, and decides to make the event black tie. He also arranges for a string quartet to play, and serves up a locally-sourced scallop starter.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Debt collector Eleri Watson hosts the fourth dinner party in Co Durham and Wearside. However, her efforts to organise an all-Welsh evening do not go according to plan when soil is found in the leek soup and lamb is served burned, dampening the guests' enthusiasm.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Businessman Ken Brown hosts the final dinner party in Co Durham and Wearside, and hopes to entertain his guests with a `wear a wig' themed evening. After annoying his fellow contestants over the past week, he hopes to make amends with his unique entertainment, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef tries to transform the fortunes of Sebastian's, a pizzeria in Burbank, Los Angeles, which is failing to attract customers, leaving the owner in debt and struggling to support his family. Gordon is horrified to discover pre-processed and frozen ingredients on the menu, but there seems to be little he can do to help when he is thrown out of the kitchen.(n)

programme.title: Undercover Boss USA
programme.desc: Amit Kleinberger, the CEO and co-owner of frozen yoghurt chain Menchie's, poses as a participant in a reality TV contest to find out whether consistency is being maintained in his stores. The company has experienced rapid growth and Amit tries to establish what changes must be made to become a billion-dollar business.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer meet two couples looking for homes in the countryside of either Kent or neighbouring East Sussex. Army wife Charley Tomlinson, her husband Patrick and their four children are hoping to leave Sandhurst behind for a place to call their own, while Simon and Tina Haben want to trade in their one-bedroom flat in London for a more family friendly house within commuting distance of the capital.(n)

programme.title: Dunkirk: The New Evidence
programme.desc: Documentary examining the famous Second World War evacuation of Allied soldiers - codenamed Operation Dynamo - from the beaches of Dunkirk, France, between May 26 and June 4, 1940. Recently released Ministry of Defence files reveal that, far from being absent as many historians have believed, the RAF was suffering massive losses supporting the evacuation. Operating at high altitude and deep inside France, RAF planes were halting the bulk of Luftwaffe bombers before they could reach the beaches. The files also reveal that the famous Spitfire took flight for the first time during the mission, and the agile fighter was a spectacular success.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: A 58-year-old woman is brought into the hospital after being run over by a lorry, suffering severe blood loss. Doctors are concerned that nerves and tissue in her leg may have suffered irreparable damage. Meanwhile, a 65-year-old man is treated after falling from a loft ladder, and a mischievous 85-year-old shows signs of severe dehydration.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in Police Custody
programme.desc: Officers prepare to interview a care worker who has been brought in for questioning despite her adamant denial of the theft of a gold bracelet from someone she was looking after. Another man in custody denies being involved in a stabbing at a corner shop, while a suspect who has been wanted for six months has finally handed himself to police to be questioned over a violent assault outside a nightclub.(n)

programme.title: Life Behind Bars: Visiting Hour
programme.desc: Cameras focus on the visiting room at HMP Low Moss, one of Scotland's largest maximum security prisons. It offers an insight into the people doing hard time as they meet loved ones. Featured contributors include Gary and Charley who plan their wedding, even though he doesn't have a release date. Meanwhile, fellow inmate Mike receives a visit from his ageing father.(n)

programme.title: First Dates
programme.desc: Diners include Sherry, a 65-year-old dominatrix looking for romance. She hopes chartered surveyor and t'ai chi enthusiast John might be the man for her. Meanwhile, Hannah, 40, is looking for a man who shares her love of adventure. Could 42-year-old Christmas tree farmer Rob be her Mr Right?.(n)

programme.title: Real, Fake or Unknown
programme.desc: Proving the authenticity of internet animal clips, with videos featuring extreme shepherding in Wales, the tale of a vengeful lion in Africa, and a New Zealand monster mystery.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Does Countdown
programme.desc: Jimmy Carr hosts the comedy panel show's version of the words-and-numbers quiz, as Jon Richardson and David O'Doherty take on guest captain Johnny Vegas and Jamie Laing. Holly Walsh joins Countdown's resident lexicographer Susie Dent in Dictionary Corner and Rachel Riley looks after the numbers and letters.(n)

programme.title: Gogglesprogs
programme.desc: Young TV viewers give their honest, inimitable and hilarious take on The Crystal Maze Celebrity Special, The Great Pottery Throw Down and classic movie The Jungle Book.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The fiery chef tries to change the fortunes of Finn McCool's, a traditional Irish pub in the Hamptons, New York. The chances of the establishment becoming a success are being ruined by the owner Buddy Mazzio's two sons, bartender Jason and chef Brian, who are constantly fighting with each other, prompting Gordon to have a heart-to-heart with the family.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The first visit of the week is to Rooms 36 in the Lake District, owned by health-conscious Andy Peters, who is joined by his friend, fellow B&B owner Jeronime Palmer.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mother and son team Trish and Connor Richardson host at the Red Lion Coaching Inn near Gainsborough, where Julie and James are not impressed by the dated bathrooms.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Julie and James host at the Schiehallion Hotel in Aberfeldy, where the guests are impressed by their rooms, but once again luxury lovers Andy and Jeronime want more from their beds.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Four in a Bed

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Canadian comedian Larah hosts the first of the week's dinner parties in Edinburgh, hoping to impress guests James, Nutan, Sindiso and Anne with a night of fine dining.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It is the second night from the competition in Edinburgh, and cafe owner Nutan is hoping her happy-go-lucky attitude will have her laughing all the way to the bank.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: The third host of the week in Edinburgh is South-African born family man Sindiso, who hopes an evening of fun inspired by his homeland will win him the £1,000 prize.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Edinburgh security company manager Anne hopes her homely, relaxed night in will be enough to win the £1,000 prize - but rising tensions between the guests may scupper her chances.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: It's the final night in Edinburgh, and pilot James is hoping a touch of sophistication in his high-flying menu will see him land safely in first place. However, after the previous night's tension, his main concern is keeping any potential explosions contained. Guests Anne and Larah have a suspicion he could be serious competition. Will James manage to produce excellent food and keep the peace, leading him to victory?.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer help two couples who are struggling to find suitable flats in Edinburgh because of the competitive market and their demanding search criteria. The first, Matt, a professional rugby player and his girlfriend Amy, have viewed more than 100 properties without success. The second pair, Sarah and Dom, are relocating from London with their one-year-old son and have a £600,000 budget, but too many special requirements for their dream home.(n)

programme.title: Location, Location, Location
programme.desc: Kirstie Allsopp and Phil Spencer use their property know-how to help a couple and two doctors who are looking for their dream homes on opposite sides of the Mersey. Gary Wakefield and his wife Nicky have an extensive wish list that includes three double bedrooms, a large garden and easy access to a top-rated school in the Wirral area, but do not have a budget to match, while graduate doctors Gemma Kealty and Susannah Brown are considering spending £200,000 on a flat share in Liverpool's Sefton Park.(n)

His neighbour discovers the truth and blackmails him into helping her kill the man who disfigured her. Crime thriller, with Colin Farrell, Noomi Rapace, Terrence Howard and Dominic Cooper.(n)

programme.title: All the President's Men
programme.desc: Conspiracy film specialist Alan J. Pakula turned journalists Bob Woodward and Carl Bernstein's best-selling account of their Watergate investigation into one of the hit films of Bicentennial year 1976. While researching a story about a botched 1972 burglary of Democratic Party headquarters at the Watergate apartment complex, green Washington Post reporters/rivals Woodward (Robert Redford, who also exec produced) and Bernstein (Dustin Hoffman) stumble on a possible connection between the burglars and a White House staffer. With the circumspect approval of executive editor Ben Bradlee (Jason Robards), the pair digs deeper. Aided by a guilt-ridden turncoat bookkeeper (Jane Alexander) and the vital if cryptic guidance of Woodward's mystery source, Deep Throat (Hal Holbrook), Woodward and Bernstein "follow the money" all the way to the top of the Nixon administration. Despite Deep Throat's warnings that their lives are in danger, and the reluctance of older Post editors, Woodward and Bernstein are determined to get out the story of the crime and its presidential cover-up. Once Bradlee is convinced, the final teletype impassively taps out the historically explosive results(n)

programme.title: Tetro
programme.desc: On the heels of the self-financed, modestly budgeted 2007 drama Youth Without Youth -- his first directorial outing after a ten-year hiatus -- filmmaker Francis Ford Coppola remains situated in the director's chair for this semi-autobiographical family drama concerning an artistic family of immigrants whose fierce rivalries span several generations. Vincent Gallo stars with newcomer Alden Ehrenreich, with Carmen Maura, Maribel Verdú, and Alden Ehrenreich rounding out the cast(n)

programme.title: Prelude to a Kiss
programme.desc: On her wedding day, bride Meg Ryan is kissed by a strange old man (Sydney Walker) who shows at the wedding uninvited. Meg and Walker instantly exchange personalities, much to the discomfort of groom Alec Baldwin. In trying to set things aright, Baldwin discover that the man is dying from cancer(n)

programme.title: Bachelor Party
programme.desc: Easygoing bus driver Rick is ready to get hitched to wealthy Debbie. But his pals won't let him get away without the messiest stag night of the decade(n)

programme.title: Say Anything...
programme.desc: Touching teenage romantic comedy drama about a middling high-school student who fails for a brilliant, beautiful, and reputedly unattainable classmate and gradually wins her over. The obstacle he can't seem to overcome is her father, who has great plans for the girl and does not want to see her diverted from her educational goals because of a relationship with a loser(n)

programme.title: Welcome to Mooseport
programme.desc: An ex-U.S. president (Gene Hackman) takes on a bumbling handyman (Ray Romano) in this madcap comedy set in a small Maine town. The men become adversaries when both run for mayor and the former chief executive starts to woo the local man's girlfriend (Maura Tierney). Marcia Gay Harden, Christine Baranski, Fred Savage, Rip Torn(n)

programme.title: Finding Neverland
programme.desc: JM Barrie was the Scottish playwright who was inspired to write Peter Pan after befriending Sylvia and her three small children. Magical family drama nominated for seven Academy Awards(n)

programme.title: Spider-Man
programme.desc: Tobey Maguire stars in the exhilarating adaptation of the world-famous Marvel superhero comic. An alienated teen is bitten by a mutated spider during a school outing and subsequently develops incredible powers. As he endeavours to come to terms with his new-found abilities, he's also forced to contend with a maniacal villain, the Green Goblin(n)

programme.title: Wish I Was Here
programme.desc: A 35-year-old father who's never quite grown up learns about life when he's forced to homeschool his kids, since their grandpa can no longer afford their private-school tuition and their public school is a mess(n)

programme.title: Anything Else
programme.desc: Woody Allen wrote and directed this delightful romantic comedy, reminiscent of his Oscar winner, "Annie Hall." Jason Biggs stars as a hapless writer frustrated by his very appealing, very neurotic girlfriend (Christina Ricci). Allen also costars as Biggs' mentor. Danny DeVito, Stockard Channing, Fisher Stevens, David Conrad, Jimmy Fallon(n)

programme.title: The Wedding Singer
programme.desc: Robbie, the wedding singer and Julia, the waitress are both engaged to be married but to the wrong people. Fortune intervenes to help them discover each other(n)

programme.title: To Be or Not to Be
programme.desc: A very funny remake of Ernst Lubitsch's classic 1942 black comedy about actors who turn spies in World War II Warsaw. A theatre troupe are unwittingly embroiled in the Polish Resistance via a young freedom fighter who is carrying on an affair with the leading lady. The thespians soon get involved in thwarting the occupying Nazis and saving the rest of the movement when their theatre is closed and they lose their luxury home(n)

programme.title: Diner
programme.desc: The autobiographical recollections of writer-director Barry Levinson recount the story of five high-school grads on the brink of adulthood in 1959 Baltimore(n)

programme.title: Into the Blue
programme.desc: When four young free divers come upon a legendary shipwreck rumoured to contain millions in gold, they believe their dreams of buried treasure has come true. But nearby on the ocean floor they unearth another, more sinister mystery..(n)

programme.title: The French Connection
programme.desc: A driven police detective and his partner track down a major international drug dealer. They begin by following a couple they suspect because the duo lives far above their apparent means. They continue to follow a trail of clues that leads to a French criminal responsible for a large percentage of the drugs that come into New York City(n)

programme.title: Carlito's Way: Rise to Power
programme.desc: Petty crime does not pay. What Harlem boys Carlito, Rocco and Earl need is a drugs outfit to rival the mob(n)

programme.title: The Rookie

programme.title: Body of Lies

Following Coughlin's advice, to buy his own bar, Flanagan hitches up with Bonnie, a rich Manhattan socialite but then falls in love with Jordan Mooney. programme.desc: (1977) Mel Brooks' love of parodying film genres ( Young Frankenstein, Blazing Saddles ) continued with this affectionate spoof of Hitchcock's films, including Psycho, North by Northwest and Vertigo . Brooks plays Dr Richard H Thorndyke, new chief of the Psychoneurotic Institute for the Very, Very Nervous. There are mysterious disappearances, attempts on his life and scary Nurse Diesel (Cloris Leachman), whose closet is full of whips, as the gags fuel the delightfully crazy plot. programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green look into the shooting of defence lawyer Vance Grodie, who had just won an acquittal for a suspected cop killer. Police drama, starring Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY
programme.desc: Teacher Evan Westcott shoots at senatorial candidate Grant Hamilton during a political rally, with Lindsay being hurt in the ensuing chaos and a tragedy occurring when a boy picks up the discarded firearm. The investigators recover bullets from the crime scene and match the casings to a gun registered to Hamilton, but the politician claims it was stolen during a break-in at his home. Guest starring Neal McDonough (Desperate Housewives, Justified).(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A Navy lieutenant is found dead in the Pentagon's custodial closet, and surveillance footage indicates she was killed by a co-worker. However, Ziva and the team discover her supposed assailant actually died of a heart attack days before the crime was committed. Meanwhile, suspicions are raised regarding the eyeball left in Tony's drink, and the investigators' attention is fixed on the port-to-port murderer, who appears to still be at large.(n)

programme.desc: Olivia discovers that the new ADA. has a deceitful secret, which if she decides to expose it may lead to the end of Rebecca's law career. programme.title: Cedar Cove

programme.title: Law & Order

programme.title: Law & Order
programme.desc: Briscoe and Green investigate the fatal stabbing of a taxi driver whose body was left under his vehicle. The finger of suspicion points to a man who took a drunken ride in the cab on the same night - an ex-convict who is also a gifted writer - and his protege, whose fingerprints were found on a book and cigar left at the scene. Saul Rubinek, JK Simmons and Sonia Braga guest star alongside Jerry Orbach and Jesse L Martin.(n)

programme.title: CSI: Crime Scene Investigation

Featuring cameos by the stars of genre shows, including Battlestar Galactica's Grace Park and Kate Vernon, and Babylon 5's Joshua Cox.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: US Navy lieutenant Paul Booth is shot dead while sitting on a park bench. It turns out that the last people he called were his boss, his wife and Penelope Langston - a rebellious academic who also happens to be McGee's grandmother. She says that the victim was an old student of hers who kept in touch, but later reveals she was recruited to work on a special project during the Vietnam War by the head of a top-secret think tank Booth was a member of. Guest starring Lily Tomlin, with Mark Harmon and Sean Murray.(n)

programme.title: NCIS
programme.desc: A man who died after being knocked down by a van is revealed to be a professional hitman responsible for at least six contract killings - and his next target was to be a navy lieutenant commander. Meanwhile, Abby is delighted at being a match for a teenager who needs a kidney transplant, but she is informed that someone else with very similar DNA has also been identified as suitable. Has she found a relative she never knew about? Guest starring Brett Tucker (Neighbours).(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Los Angeles
programme.desc: After a stylist to the stars is murdered in her car on her way home, conspiracy theories are rife in the Hollywood community, and detectives Morales and Jaruszalski discover evidence that puts them on a hunt through her past. Crime drama, starring Corey Stoll and Skeet Ulrich and featuring a guest appearance by reality TV star Khloe Kardashian.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

Anthony Anderson and Natalie Cole guest star alongside Christopher Meloni.(n)

programme.title: Law & Order: Special Victims Unit

programme.desc: The detectives trace the identities of two murdered teenagers and discover one had a sister who was travelling with them. Physical evidence implicates her in the crimes, but she claims to have been an unwilling accomplice. Ellen Pompeo (Grey's Anatomy) guest stars.(n)

programme.title: CSI: NY

programme.desc: The investigators examine the death of US marine Tommy Hill, who appears to have been fatally stabbed en route to a homecoming party thrown in his honour by his foster family. programme.desc: Callen and the team are called in to look for the body of a murdered Muslim man that has gone missing from the morgue. programme.title: Gilmore Girls
programme.sub-title: Last Week Fights, This Week Tights
programme.desc: Last Week Fights, This Week Tights. programme.title: Dirty Dancing
programme.desc: The late Hollywood heartthrob Patrick Swayze and Golden Globe nominee Jennifer Grey team up as dirty dance partners in this Oscar winning romantic classic. A teenage girl learns about love, adult responsibility, and how to do The Dirty Boogie. A teenage girl learns about love, adult responsibility, and how to do The Dirty Boogie in this romantic drama. In 1963, "Baby" Houseman (Jennifer Grey) is a 17-year-old spending the summer with her family at a resort hotel in the Catskills; she plans on being in the Peace Corps next summer, so this is expected to be her last summer as a carefree adolescent. Baby doesn't get along with her older sister, Lisa (Jane Brucker), and she's bored to tears by most of the older guests at the resort. However, one night Baby hears what sounds like a party going on in the employee's dormitory, and she pokes her head in to discover most of the hotel staff enjoying the sort of close dancing that would get you kicked out of the senior prom in no time flat. Baby is particularly struck by handsome Johnny Castle (Patrick Swayze), a dancer in the resort's floor show, and falls head over heels in love, wanting to be near him. Dirty Dancing was a surprise box-office hit, and the soundtrack album was an even bigger success, spawning several hit singles. Starring Patrick Swayze, Jennifer Grey & Jane Brucker(n)

programme.title: Grease
programme.desc: "Grease," said the poster and the Barry Gibb song, "is the word." Transferring its setting from Chicago to sunny California, and adding a dash of disco to the ersatz '50s score, producer Allan Carr and director Randal Kleiser turned this long-running Jim Jacobs-Warren Casey Broadway smash into the biggest blockbuster of 1978. 1950s teens Danny (John Travolta) and Australian transfer Sandy (Olivia Newton-John) spend their "Summer Nights" falling in love, but once fall comes, it's back to Rydell High and its cliques. As one of the bad-boy T-Birds, Danny has to act cool for best pal Kenickie (Jeff Conaway) and their leather-clad mates Sonny (Michael Tucci) and Doody (Barry Pearl, in the role Travolta played on-stage). Despite befriending Frenchy (Didi Conn), one of the rebel Pink Ladies, virginal Sandy is "too pure to be Pink," as the Ladies' leader, Rizzo (Stockard Channing), acidly observes. Declaring their devotion in such ballads as "Hopelessly Devoted to You" and "Sandy," Sandy and Danny split, reconcile, and split again amidst a pep rally, dances, drive-ins, and a drag race, before deciding "You're the One That I Want" at the climactic carnival. With Travolta white-hot from Saturday Night Fever (1977), Grease soundtrack singles climbed the charts and summer movie crowds poured in. With the presence of Joan Blondell, Eve Arden, Sid Caesar, Edd "Kookie" Byrnes, and Frankie Avalon appealing to grown-up memories, Grease became the highest-grossing film of 1978, the highest-grossing movie musical ever, and the third most popular film of the new blockbuster '70s after Star Wars (1977) and Jaws (1975). Its sequel, Grease 2, did not exactly set the world on fire in 1982(n)

programme.title: The Devil Wears Prada
programme.desc: Lauren Weisberger's best-selling novel about a young woman who stumbles into the hectic worlds of high fashion and publishing comes to the big screen in this comedy. Andrea "Andy" Sachs (Anne Hathaway) is a bright young woman from the Midwest who has just graduated from college and wants to work as a magazine writer. Andy has applied for a job at "Runway," America's most prestigious fashion journal; though Andy has little to no interest in the garment trade, they are one of the only magazines in New York with a job opening -- second assistant to editor Miranda Priestly (Meryl Streep). As Andy quickly learns, Miranda is a diva with plenty of power within the magazine business and she isn't afraid to use it, and though Andy lands the job (primarily by being in the right place at the right time), she soon learns that working for Miranda could test the patience of a saint thanks to her endless demands and refusal to acknowledge the end of a work day. Andy struggles to hold on to the job and her sanity, knowing that a recommendation from Miranda can open nearly any door at any magazine, but can she handle the pressure without losing her mind along the way? The Devil Wears Prada also stars Stanley Tucci, Emily Blunt, and Adrian Grenier(n)

programme.title: Mean Girls
programme.desc: Lindsay Lohan stars as Cady Heron who, having been home-schooled by her parents, is new to high school and totally unversed on how to survive the jungle-like teen society. But, befriended by two other outsiders, goth Janis and gay Damian, she infiltrates queen bee Regina George's hive to bring about her downfall. Mark (Freaky Friday) Waters' teen comedy is a cut above the rest, thanks to a smart screenplay from Saturday Night Live regular Tina Fey (based on Rosalind Wiseman's non-fiction survival guide for young girls, Queen Bees and Wannabees ) and outstanding performances not just from Lohan, but the whole cast (watch out for Tim Meadows as the scene-stealing Principal Duvall)(n)

Regular weekly features included "K9 Cops and Animal Heroes," "Celebrity Owners," and "Animal Bloopers." programme.title: The Three Stooges
programme.desc: A Bird in the Head. This typical Three Stooges 2-reel comedy, was the third to be directed by former sound engineer Edward Bernds but, a rather weak effort, only the second released.. According to Bernds, the reason for the film's inadequacy was his own inexperience combined with Curly's increasingly poor health. The most popular Stooge of all time, Curly Howard would suffer a debilitating stroke less than a year later and would be replaced by his brother Shemp Howard. In A Bird in the Head featured the Stooges as paperhangers who get involved with a mad professor (Vernon Dent). The professor is looking for a human brain small enough to fit into a gorilla. The answer: Curly, of course! The 2-reeler marked the Stooges debut of veteran serial menace Frank Lackteen(n)

programme.desc: Fourteen-year-old Mattie Ross (Hailee Steinfeld) joins an aging U.S. marshal (Jeff Bridges) and another lawman (Matt Damon) in tracking her father's killer into hostile Indian territory in Joel and Ethan Coen's adaptation of Charles Portis' original novel. Sticking more closely to the source material than the 1969 feature adaptation starring Western icon John Wayne, the Coens' True Grit tells the story from the young girl's perspective, and re-teams the celebrated filmmaking duo with their No Country for Old Men producing partner Scott Rudin. Josh Brolin and Barry Pepper co-star(n)

The only things the two cops have in common are their outsized egos and an underworld crime boss--who frames them in a drug deal. Finding themselves in prison together, the unlikely duo break out and go after the mobster in this wise-cracking, fast-paced action thriller. Starring Sylvester Stallone, Kurt Russell & Teri Hatcher(n)

programme.title: The Road Warrior

programme.title: Pitch Black
programme.desc: A deep space transporter crash-lands on a desolate planet circled by three suns. Among the survivors are pilot Radha Mitchell, mystic Keith David, cop Cole Hauser and convicted criminal Vin Diesel, and their first thoughts are of survival and escape. Then Mitchell finds out that the planet suffers a total eclipse every 22 years, which is when the hibernating, flesh-eating inhabitants awake and hunt. Now the race is on just to stay alive... David Twohy's film switches from bleached out wasteland to fearful darkness as the suns disappear and the terror begins(n)

programme.title: Carlito's Way
programme.desc: Al Pacino's gritty performance propels this saga about a former drug lord's efforts to go straight(n)

programme.title: The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy
programme.desc: Douglas Adams' oft-adapted tale of an normal guy making his way through the universe (it's already been presented as a novel, a radio serial, a television series, and a comic book) finally makes its way to the big screen in this endearingly goofy sci-fi comedy. Arthur Dent (Martin Freeman) is a very ordinary man who is having a truly unusual day -- after discovering that one of his best friends, Ford Prefect (Mos Def), is actually an alien, Ford tells him that the planet Earth is going to be destroyed so that otherworldly forces can make room for construction of a hyperspace bypass. Since Arthur accidentally saved Ford's life years ago, Ford does him a favor -- he first gets him a ride on a spaceship passing by, and then presents him with a guidebook that will tell a beginner everything he needs to know as he hitchhikes through outer space. Along the way, Arthur encounters such interstellar notables as sleazy Galaxy president Zaphod Beebelbrox (Sam Rockwell), the girl of his dreams Tricia McMillan (Zooey Deschanel), perpetually glum robot Marvin (voice of Alan Rickman), interplanetary construction magnate Slartibartfast (Bill Nighy), and cult leader Humma Kavula (John Malkovich). The Hitchhiker's Guide to the Galaxy was the first feature film for Garth Jennings, previously best known for his work in television commercials and music videos; he was recommended to the producers by director Spike Jonze after Jonze had to turn down an offer to head up the project(n)

programme.title: Deepwater Horizon
programme.desc: Riveting docudrama about the Deepwater Horizon disaster, the 2010 oil-rig explosion that resulted in the largest offshore oil spill in U.S. history. The film depicts the challenges that the rig's crew faced as they fought for survival(n)

programme.title: Eraser
programme.desc: When business executive Lee Cullen uncovers a plot to deliver a super-weapon into enemy hands, she is assigned to the witness protection programme under US Marshal John 'Eraser' Kruger. But just who is hunting Lee down? Action(n)

programme.title: Role Models
programme.desc: A pair of irresponsible energy drink salesmen realize that serving a month of hard time is nothing compared to spending 150 hours in a community mentorship program after they trash the company truck and find themselves at the mercy of the court in this comedy starring Seann William Scott and Paul Rudd. Wheeler (Scott) and Danny (Rudd) wouldn't necessarily be the first people a parent would turn to when seeking out a babysitter, in fact, they probably wouldn't even make the list in the first place. After slamming a few too many Minotaur energy drinks and crashing the company truck, however, the two loose-living pals narrowly avert jail when the court decides to let them become mentors to a group of young misfits. But how is the recently dumped Danny supposed to help bashful, role-playing geek Augie (Christopher Mintz-Plasse) become a man when all he can offer the boy is bitter sarcasm, and is beer-chugging man-child Wheeler really the best choice to help foul-mouthed fifth-grader Ronnie (Bobb'e J. Thompson) develop more respect for his elders? Probably not, but they'll have to do their best anyway when the center's ex-con director (Jane Lynch) confronts them with a harsh ultimatum. Now, if Wheeler and Danny can just make it through the rest of their probation without getting tossed in jail, maybe there's hope for the boys -- and Danny's relationship with his fed-up girlfriend (Elizabeth Banks) -- after all(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: Round-up of national and international news, plus the latest from the money markets.(n)

programme.title: Crimewatch Roadshow
programme.desc: Tina Daheley and Rav Wilding appeal for the public's help with unsolved crimes. The team follows an operation to crack down on counterfeit goods in south Wales. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Homes Under the Hammer
programme.desc: Martin Roberts, Lucy Alexander and Dion Dublin tour properties in Mountain Ash in south Wales, Elstree in Hertfordshire and Newport in Shropshire, then talk to the new owners about their renovation plans, before cameras return to see how they have got on.(n)

programme.title: Kitchen Garden Live with the Hairy Bikers
programme.desc: Charlotte Ritchie, Call the Midwife's Barbara Gilbert, joins Si King and Dave Myers to enjoy some food in the sun at The Hampton Court Palace Flower Show. Plus, Dave gets a tour around another show-stopping garden featuring incredible edibles and Si gets the low-down on growing garlic. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Caught Red Handed
programme.desc: The case of an ex-policeman, who decided to use social media to catch the culprit behind the theft of a charity tin. Presented by Dominic Littlewood.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Eric Knowles presents from the city of York, as two teams call upon the services of experts Nick Hall and Jonathan Pratt as they peruse the contents of two antique centres, investing a total of £300 on items they hope to profit from at an auction in Darlington.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker is at the All England Club, where the third Grand Slam tournament of the year continues with matches including Andy Murray v Fabio Fognini and Rafael Nadal v Karen Khachanov. Despite still being world number one, Murray has endured a disappointing year by his standards so far, but was impressive in his straight-sets victory over Dustin Brown in the previous round. In contrast, Nadal looked to be getting back to his very best when winning his 10th French Open last month, and will be expecting to reach round four for the first time since 2014.(n)

programme.title: The One Show
programme.desc: Comedian and writer Katherine Ryan joins regular host Alex Jones for the final edition of the week, featuring the usual mix of celebrity guests and stories about people in extraordinary circumstances.(n)

programme.title: A Question of Sport
programme.desc: Sue Barker hosts the light-hearted quiz, with former England batsman James Taylor, Olympic silver medal-winning taekwondo star Lutalo Muhammad, Olympic hockey champion Alex Danson and ex-West Ham United striker Dean Ashton joining Matt Dawson and Phil Tufnell in a test of their sporting knowledge.(n)

programme.title: EastEnders
programme.desc: The Taylors cause trouble in the Square, and later on, Karen comes to a worrying realisation. Steven struggles to stay in control as he continues to spy on Lauren, while Sonia is frustrated with Dot when she refuses to listen to her doctor's advice. Sharon is livid when Louise goes behind her back and talks to Phil about moving schools. Michelle agrees to go on a date with Tom.(n)

programme.title: Count Arthur Strong
programme.desc: Arthur makes some unlikely new friends while in search of biscuits, and sees his life and luck change overnight. Comedy, with Steve Delaney and Rory Kinnear.(n)

programme.title: Peter Kay's Comedy Shuffle
programme.desc: The comedian, actor, writer and director recalls an ambitious nationwide challenge for Comic Relief and discusses his involvement in an armed raid with chat show supremo Michael Parkinson. Featuring appearances by This Morning hosts Phillip Schofield and Holly Willoughby.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: It seems that everyone in the Brown family has a date for Valentine's Day except Agnes, so she turns to the internet to find herself a man. Dermot tries to come up with a loving gesture to prove to Maria he can still be romantic - but he makes the mistake of taking advice from Buster - while Agnes and Winnie are fascinated by Betty's sex manual and Grandad ends up addicted to Viagra. Hit comedy, starring Brendan O'Carroll.(n)

programme.title: Not Going Out
programme.desc: Seven years into their marriage, Lee and Lucy face the daily onslaught of raising Charlie and his twin siblings, five-year-olds Benji and Molly. Lovably feckless father Frank remains around and close friends including world-weary Toby and uptight ice-queen Anna are still on the scene. Thankfully, Lucy's more dependable parents Geoffrey and Wendy can be relied upon when the going gets tough. However, while juggling the ongoing needs of those around him, the pair disagree about the best way to keep the romance alive. Comedy, starring Lee Mack and Sally Bretton.(n)

programme.title: Begin Again
programme.desc: A singer-songwriter is left cast adrift when her boyfriend leaves her after becoming a star. While performing in New York's East Village, she meets a record company executive whose career is in tatters, beginning a collaboration that turns both their lives around. Comedy drama, starring Keira Knightley and Mark Ruffalo.(n)

programme.title: Breakfast
programme.desc: A round-up of national and international news, plus sports reports, weather forecasts and arts and entertainment features. Including NewsWatch at 7.45.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Kitchen Live
programme.desc: Matt Tebbutt is at the RHS Hampton Court Palace Flower Show, where he is joined by Neil Rankin and Andi Oliver, who cook in the show's specially designed edible garden.(n)

programme.title: Mary Berry Cooks
programme.desc: The food writer and Great British Bake Off judge gives advice on making a casual weekday supper for sharing around the kitchen table with friends or family. She prepares a Mediterranean platter of houmous, breadsticks, roasted vegetables and tomato and mozzarella salad, as well as lamb dhansak, cottage pie topped with dauphinoise potatoes, and a pasta dish that takes just 15 minutes. She also shows to make elderflower cordial and a crunchy apple crumble.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces further live coverage of day six at the All England Club, featuring third-round matches in the men's and ladies' singles. There was no doubt as to the main headline on day six last year, which saw defending men's champion Novak Djokovic crash out in a thrilling four-set encounter on Court One, losing 6-7, 1-6, 6-3, 6-7 to America's Sam Querrey. The defeat ended Djokovic's 30-match winning streak in Grand Slam events and left Andy Murray as the highest ranked player in the draw, while there were also wins for Angelique Kerber, Simona Halep, Kei Nishikori and Agnieszka Radwanska.(n)

programme.title: Pointless Celebrities
programme.desc: Ed Baines and Paul Rankin team up to battle fellow chefs Tony Singh and Cyrus Todiwala, Jean-Christophe Novelli joins forces with TV cook Jo Pratt and former Great British Bake Off finalist Richard Burr works together with 2013 finalist Frances Quinn, as Alexander Armstrong and Richard Osman present a `food and drink' themed edition of the star-studded general knowledge quiz.(n)

programme.title: Pitch Battle
programme.desc: The choral music contest reaches its fourth heat, as another six diverse groups seek to demonstrate their vocal skills. This time, the ensembles are a cappella group The Bristol Suspensions, Liverpool pop choir Over the Water, all-female country group The Savannahs, show choir Perfect 6th, Portsmouth University Gospel Choir and musical theatre performers Vocal-i-sing. Each group is given a chance to display their speciality with a `showstopper' performance, before battling it out with their rivals in a themed `riff-off'. Guest judge Seal joins Gareth Malone and Kelis on the panel.(n)

programme.title: Casualty
programme.desc: Ethan discovers Scott's brother Mickey is in a secret relationship with Jez, and he seeks to befriend the lad and turn him against his sibling. However, when Mickey proves to be too terrified to help, Ethan turns to blackmail instead, earning disapproval from both Jez and Alicia. Meanwhile, Connie pulls rank on Sam when he asks for time off to take Grace to a physiotherapy session, and later, Sam spots a chance to undermine Connie while treating a bride who mysteriously collapsed at the altar.(n)

programme.title: Little Fockers
programme.desc: Nurse Greg is now the proud father of twins, but has yet to earn the respect of his wife's stern father after 10 years of marriage. The couple invite both sides of their extended family to the kids' birthday party, where Greg makes a desperate effort to finally prove his worth to his father-in-law. Comedy sequel, with Ben Stiller, Robert De Niro, Owen Wilson and Dustin Hoffman.(n)

programme.title: Tropic Thunder
programme.desc: A director's epic Vietnam movie is behind schedule and over budget. Taking the advice of the grizzled war veteran on whose life the film is based, he drops the actors into a jungle with the intention of filming them fighting guerrilla-style - but the cast is unaware the surrounding warfare is genuine. Comedy, directed by and starring Ben Stiller, with Jack Black, Steve Coogan and, in an Oscar-nominated role, Robert Downey Jr.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: The TV That Made Me
programme.desc: Writer and comedy actor Adil Ray joins Brian Conley to discuss the shows of his youth, and to explain how the Liverpool-set Bread inspired him to create Asian sitcom Citizen Khan.(n)

programme.title: Flog It! Trade Secrets
programme.desc: A selection of some of the more unusual items featured on the programme. Plus, Paul Martin meets the stonemasons breathing new life into Oxford's dreaming spires.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Tim Wonnacott presents the competition from Hay-on-Wye, Powys, where teams are guided by experts Charles Hanson and Jonathan Pratt through plenty of highs and lows. Meanwhile, the presenter stumbles across an interesting find with a well-travelled past.(n)

programme.title: Gardeners' World
programme.desc: Monty Don plants a tree fern in the damp garden and uses netting to protect his soft fruits from birds. Carol Klein selects hardy geraniums as her Plant of the Month, Flo Headlam visits an inspiring church garden in Lewisham that feeds both the mind and body, and Nick Bailey gets an insight into the impact of parasitoid wasps on gardens.(n)

programme.title: Victoria Derbyshire
programme.desc: Daily news and current-affairs programme offering discussion of breaking stories, exclusive interviews and audience interaction via social media.(n)

programme.title: Daily Politics
programme.desc: Parliamentary proceedings interspersed with discussions, interviews and filmed reports from around the country, presented by Jo Coburn.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker introduces the opening coverage of day five at SW19, where the men's and ladies' third-round singles matches are due to get under way, including Victoria Azarenka v Heather Watson, Johanna Konta v Maria Sakkari and Kei Nishikori v Roberto Bautista-Agut. British players Watson and Konta are both looking to reach the fourth round for the first time in their careers, but a former world number one stands in Watson's way, while Sakkari is yet to drop a set.(n)

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding presents highlights of the fifth day's play, which featured matches in the top half of the men's draw and bottom half of the ladies' draw. The players will have been eager to complete their fixtures today, which would give them a full weekend off to prepare for the last 16 on Monday, and a break from the intensity of the third Grand Slam tournament of the year.(n)

programme.title: RHS Hampton Court Palace Flower Show
programme.desc: Arit Anderson and Mark Lane take a look at the show gardens designed to deliver powerful messages, while Monty Don meets the designer who is greening up Britain's brownfield spaces. Nick Bailey investigates how best to care for orchids, and Toby Buckland discovers the best house plants at the show. Carol Klein reveals the pollinators best suited to British gardens, whilst Rachel de Thame meets the team putting Australasian plants on the map in the UK. Adam Frost concludes his masterclass on how plants can maximise viewers' own gardens design credentials. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Newsnight
programme.desc: Analysis of the day's events, presented by Evan Davis.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Lake
programme.desc: Twelve-year-old Tui Mitcham walks out into a lake on New Zealand's South Island, but is saved before she freezes or drowns. She is found to be pregnant and local police call in child-protection specialist Robin Griffin, a detective based in Australia who is in the area to visit her sick mother. Thriller co-written by Oscar winner Jane Campion, starring Elisabeth Moss, Peter Mullan and Holly Hunter.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Lake
programme.desc: As the search for Tui Mitcham escalates and fears for her survival grow, Robin pursues a suspect to his house for questioning, but the situation quickly spirals out of control. The detective later goes to the women's camp at Paradise where the girl was last seen, but ends up being interrogated herself by the enigmatic GJ. Thriller set in New Zealand, starring Elisabeth Moss and Holly Hunter.(n)

programme.title: Panorama
programme.desc: As one of Britain's largest youth groups, the cadet forces are responsible for nearly 130,000 children in more than 2,000 clubs across the country. Katie Razzall investigates sexual abuse within these forces, and examines questions facing the Government organisation in overall charge - the Ministry of Defence.(n)

programme.title: Doctor Who
programme.desc: Peter Capaldi's tenure as the Doctor draws close to its conclusion, as the Mondasian Cybermen rise. Not seen since the classic, pre-2005 series, the original Cybermen came from Mondas, `Earth's twin planet', and posed a fearsome threat to the Time Lord and his companions. Now, these sinister cyborgs begin a new conquest, and the Doctor makes a final stand to protect a tiny band of humans from utter destruction. Pearl Mackie and Matt Lucas also star as Bill and Nardole, Michelle Gomez reprises her role as Missy, while John Simm puts in an appearance as the Master. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: This Is BBC Two
programme.desc: Preview of upcoming programmes from BBC Two.(n)

programme.title: Lucky Partners
programme.desc: A woman is wished good luck by a neighbour, and goes on to have a lucky day. Deciding he is a source of good fortune, she persuades him to share a sweepstake ticket with her. However, her fiance is not happy when their horse wins and they plan to go on holiday with the money. Romantic comedy, starring Ginger Rogers, Ronald Colman and Jack Carson.(n)

programme.title: Talking Pictures
programme.desc: Profile of Oscar-winning actor John Mills, featuring clips from TV appearances he made during his seven-decade career, and capturing the milestones and highlights of his fame. Narrated by Sylvia Syms.(n)

programme.title: Scott of the Antarctic
programme.desc: Fact-based drama following explorer Robert Falcon Scott's failed expedition to be the first to reach the South Pole. The extreme conditions, poor decision-making and the pressure of the race to make it to the Pole before their Norwegian rivals proved too much for the British team, resulting in tragedy in 1912. Starring John Mills, Derek Bond, James Robertson Justice, Kenneth More and John Gregson.(n)

programme.title: Athletics
programme.desc: The Athletissima. Gabby Logan introduces action from the eighth meeting of the season, which took place at Stade Olympique de la Pontaise in Lausanne, Switzerland.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker presents from the All England Club, where the sixth day's play gets under way with the latest men's and ladies' singles third-round matches.(n)

programme.title: Bargain Hunt
programme.desc: Two teams are challenged to pick up bargains in London's Portobello Road under the expert guidance of Jonathan Pratt and Kate Bliss, with Tim Wonnacott overseeing proceedings.(n)

programme.title: Father of the Bride
programme.desc: A doting father recounts the story of his daughter's wedding from the announcement of her engagement to the big day itself. The experience presents him with a series of challenges as he deals with an escalating budget, tension with his new in-laws and the mixed emotions of losing his little girl. Comedy, starring Spencer Tracy and Elizabeth Taylor.(n)

programme.title: Wimbledon 2017
programme.desc: Sue Barker presents further live coverage of the Grand Slam tournament, featuring matches in the bottom half of the men's draw and top half of the ladies' draw. Andy Murray continued his serene progress on this day last year, defeating Australia's John Millman in straight sets, to move into the second week of the championships without having dropped a set. Murray was followed onto Centre Court by Milos Raonic, the man he would go on to play in the final, and the Canadian edged three close sets to book his own place in the last 16. In the ladies' draw, there were notable defeats for former champion Petra Kvitova and 2014 runner-up Eugenie Bouchard.(n)

programme.title: Today at Wimbledon
programme.desc: Clare Balding introduces highlights of the sixth day's play at SW19, where the line-up for the last 16 was set to be decided. The middle Saturday is always a special occasion at SW19 and the crowd on Centre Court last year were treated to the sight of Milos Raonic and Andy Murray progressing to the fourth round with respective victories over Jack Sock and John Millman, while Novak Djokovic was dumped out of the tournament on Court One against Sam Querrey.(n)

programme.title: Museum of the Year
programme.desc: Tristram Hunt, the newly appointed director of the Victoria and Albert Museum in London, presents coverage of Art Fund's 2017 Museum of the Year ceremony. This year, the finalists are London's Tate Modern and John Soane Museum, the Newmarket Heritage Centre for Horseracing and Sporting Art, Birmingham's Lapworth Museum of Geology, and the Hepworth art gallery in Wakefield. In 2016, the V&A claimed the coveted award, and here, Tristram seeks tips and advice on maintaining its lofty reputation from those responsible for running the museums up for recognition this year.(n)

programme.title: Mock the Week
programme.desc: Dara O Briain and regular panellist Hugh Dennis look back on another eventful week in news and politics, with the help of fellow comedians Angela Barnes, Ed Byrne, Hal Cruttenden, Ed Gamble and Zoe Lyons. Stand-up and improvisation are the name of the game as the contestants try to get one up on each other.(n)

programme.title: QI XL
programme.desc: Stephen Fry hosts an extended edition of the notoriously obscure quiz show, in which he awards points for answers he finds most interesting. This edition sees Bill Bailey, Jo Brand and Greg Davies join regular panellist Alan Davies to tackle miscellaneous marriage and mating matters.(n)

programme.title: 2001: A Space Odyssey
programme.desc: Scientists detect a mysterious black monolith on the moon is transmitting a signal to Jupiter. A spacecraft is sent on a mission to investigate the origins of the strange object, but as they near their destination, the astronauts realise the computer controlling the ship is turning against them. Stanley Kubrick's sci-fi epic, with Keir Dullea, William Sylvester, Gary Lockwood and Leonard Rossiter.(n)

programme.title: World News Today
programme.desc: The day's leading stories.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: John Peel and David Jenson introduce performances by Matt Bianco, Van Halen, Alexei Sayle, Break Machine, Wang Chung, Slade, Nena and Julia & Company.(n)

programme.title: Becoming a Lied Singer: Thomas Quasthoff and the Art of German Song
programme.desc: Drawing on his multiple roles as maestro, teacher and founder of the Das Lied International singing competition, Thomas Quasthoff takes audiences on a personal journey into this short, but intensely expressive art form. He focuses on Franz Schubert as the first great Lieder writer, and in Hamburg delves into the life and work of Johannes Brahms, a composer he feels a great empathy with. The programme includes rare archive footage of Thomas performing with pianist Andras Schiff in 2003 (prior to his retirement from the classical stage), as well as a newly restored telerecording of Thomas's Lied singing hero, Dietrich Fischer-Dieskau.(n)

programme.title: Rock 'n' Roll Guns for Hire: The Story of the Sideman
programme.desc: Earl Slick, David Bowie's sideman of 40 years, looks at the men and women behind some of the greatest songs of the 20th and 21st century. The sidemen are often the forgotten `guns for hire' that changed musical history and this documentary reveals what it feels like to live in the shadow of a star, a story of triumph and thwarted ambition. Contributors include Mick Jagger, Keith Richards and Billy Joel, as well as sidemen past and present for Prince, David Bowie, John Lennon, Otis Redding, the Rolling Stones and Beyonce.(n)

programme.title: Girls in Bands at the BBC
programme.desc: Compilation of performances by some of the best female musicians in rock, from the 1970s to the present day. Artists featured include American rock group Fanny, the powerful vocals of Elkie Brooks on Vinegar Joe's Proud to Be a Honky Tonk Woman, the poetry of Patti Smith's Horses and upbeat energy of the Go-Go's on We Got the Beat.(n)

programme.title: The Genius of David Bowie
programme.desc: A compilation showcasing some of the musician's performances from the BBC archives, including Space Oddity, Life on Mars?, Fashion and The Jean Genie. Plus, Lulu and Mott the Hoople perform Bowie songs, and there are further clips featuring the star's musical collaborators Iggy Pop and Lou Reed.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: John Peel and David Jenson introduce performances by Matt Bianco, Van Halen, Alexei Sayle, Break Machine, Wang Chung, Slade, Nena and Julia & Company.(n)

programme.title: Rock 'n' Roll Guns for Hire: The Story of the Sideman
programme.desc: Earl Slick, David Bowie's sideman of 40 years, looks at the men and women behind some of the greatest songs of the 20th and 21st century. The sidemen are often the forgotten `guns for hire' that changed musical history and this documentary reveals what it feels like to live in the shadow of a star, a story of triumph and thwarted ambition. Contributors include Mick Jagger, Keith Richards and Billy Joel, as well as sidemen past and present for Prince, David Bowie, John Lennon, Otis Redding, the Rolling Stones and Beyonce.(n)

programme.title: Sounds of the Eighties
programme.desc: Showcasing a selection of musical performances from the BBC archives, featuring Depeche Mode, the Human League, Soft Cell, Yazoo, New Order, Bronski Beat, Pet Shop Boys and Erasure.(n)

programme.title: Girls in Bands at the BBC
programme.desc: Compilation of performances by some of the best female musicians in rock, from the 1970s to the present day. Artists featured include American rock group Fanny, the powerful vocals of Elkie Brooks on Vinegar Joe's Proud to Be a Honky Tonk Woman, the poetry of Patti Smith's Horses and upbeat energy of the Go-Go's on We Got the Beat.(n)

programme.title: Britain and the Sea
programme.desc: David Dimbleby sails along the coast of East Anglia, exploring how Britain's view of the sea has changed over the past 200 years. The coast and the beach became a playground for the nation, inspiring artists, transforming coastal architecture and creating a seaside culture that remains uniquely British. Setting out from Gorleston-on-Sea, he travels down the Suffolk and Essex coasts and into the Thames, until he reaches Greenwich. Along the way he discovers works of art that reflect Britain's evolving relationship with the sea, meets a sand sculptor and visits the Queen's House in Greenwich, built in 1616 as a waterside retreat for Queen Anne and now home to Britain's greatest collection of maritime artefacts. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Nature's Great Events
programme.desc: How the growth of phytoplankton along the coastal waters of Alaska and British Columbia attracts a vast array of marine life to feast on billions of herring. Footage includes humpback whales migrating from Hawaii as well as Steller sea lions, dolphins and killer whales that make the long and arduous journey toward the abundant fish, risking malnutrition and attacks from predators along the way. Narrated by David Attenborough. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Mea Culpa
programme.desc: Premiere. A police officer leaves the force in disgrace after drunkenly causing an accident that killed three people. Years later, his son witnesses a crime and is targeted by gangsters. The boy's father turns to his old partner for help, and together they fight to bring down the crime syndicate. Crime thriller, starring Vincent Lindon and Gilles Lellouche. In French.(n)

programme.title: Titanic's Tragic Twin: The Britannic Disaster
programme.desc: Kate Humble and Andy Torbet try to piece together the events of November 21, 1916, when the Britannic, sister ship to the Titanic, sank in just 55 minutes. Kate speaks to some of the survivors' descendants, including those of Violet Jessops, who survived both Titanic and Britannic, and look-out Archie Jewell, who survived when those around him lost their lives.(n)

programme.title: Top of the Pops: 1984
programme.desc: Mike Read and Janice Long present the February 23 show, featuring Hot Chocolate, Rockwell, Nik Kershaw, Carmel and Howard Jones.(n)

programme.title: FIM Enduro World Championship
programme.desc: The best of the action from the GP of Greece, the fifth round of the 2017 FIM Enduro World Championship.(n)

programme.title: DTM Review
programme.desc: Highlights from round four of the Deutsche Tourenwagen Masters at the Norisring. Drivers who have previously competed in this series include Mika Hakkinen and David Coulthard.(n)

programme.title: PSA Squash Highlights
programme.desc: A round-up from the 2017 El Gouna International in Egypt.(n)

programme.title: PSA Squash Highlights
programme.desc: The best of the action from the Women's World Championship in El Gouna, Egypt.(n)

programme.title: PSA Squash Highlights
programme.desc: A round-up from the PSA World Series Finals in Dubai as Britain's Laura Massaro faced Nour El Sherbini in the women's final and James Willstrop took on Mohamed Elshorbagy.(n)

programme.title: Live AFL
programme.sub-title: Live AFL: Adelaide C v W.Bulldogs.
programme.desc: Adelaide Crows and Western Bulldogs clash in round 16 of the Australian Football League. This is a season-defining game for the Bulldogs, who have lost three of their last four.(n)

programme.title: BT Sport Reload
programme.desc: The best bits from BT Sport from the last week, exclusive interviews, the best action and so much more.(n)

programme.title: 30 for 30
programme.desc: This documentary, part of the acclaimed 30 for 30 series, tells the story of how Baltimore's fans coped with losing their NFL team in 1984.(n)

programme.title: FIM Speedway World Cup
programme.desc: Round two of the Speedway World Cup in Vastervik, Sweden. Nations include Sweden, Latvia, Denmark and Russia, with the winner qualifying for the final in Leszno, Poland.(n)

programme.title: FIA F3 European Championship Highlights
programme.desc: Highlights from the fifth round of the season at the Norisring. The series has established itself as one of the leading junior categories in international single-seater racing.(n)

programme.title: Live FIM Speedway World Cup
programme.desc: Australia, Latvia, Russia and the USA do battle in the Speedway World Cup race-off at the Alfred Smoczyk Stadium in Leszno, Poland. The winner qualifies for Saturday's final.(n)

programme.title: Sport in Focus
programme.desc: Newly-retired former All Blacks fly-half Nick Evans, regarded as one of Premiership Rugby's most famous imports, reflects on his nine year career at Harlequins.(n)

programme.desc: Daphne offers to host a dinner party to celebrate Niles' latest purchase, knowing that previous soirees held by the brothers have ended badly. However, after the previous night's tension, his main concern is keeping any potential explosions contained. Guests Anne and Larah have a suspicion he could be serious competition. Will James manage to produce excellent food and keep the peace, leading him to victory?.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons

With the guest voices of Sondheim, Meg Ryan and Peter Bogdanovich.(n)

programme.title: Hollyoaks

programme.title: Channel 4 News
programme.desc: Including sport and weather.(n)

programme.title: Gogglesprogs

programme.title: The Crystal Maze
programme.desc: Richard Ayoade guides Joel Dommett, Jermaine Jenas, Adil Ray, Tamara Wall and team captain Rylan Clark-Neal on an epic adventure through four fantastical zones - Aztec, Medieval, Industrial and Futuristic. In each zone the team members must conquer physical, skill, mystery and mental challenges in a bid to win crystals. These elusive crystals each give them five seconds inside the iconic Crystal Dome, where they hope to collect gold tokens to convert into prizes.(n)

programme.title: The Last Leg
programme.desc: Adam Hills, Josh Widdicombe and Alex Brooker are joined by comedians Roisin Conaty and Kumail Nanjiani for a light-hearted review of the significant moments of the past seven days. The quintet offer their own unique insight into some of the most difficult and delicate issues in modern Britain, and answer that most important of questions: is it OK?.(n)

programme.title: Naked Attraction
programme.desc: Anna Richardson presents the dating show in which two singletons choose their favourite from a line-up of potential dates who reveal themselves one body part at a time - in all their naked glory. First up is 19-year-old student Marlie from Yorkshire, who keeps choosing the bad boys - which is driving her mum mad. There's also 30-year-old Adam, from Bradford. Having previously had his heart broken, he is now looking for a woman with no secrets, and believes that if the contestants are willing to bare all on TV, they probably have nothing to hide.(n)

programme.title: The Windsors
programme.desc: New series. The satirical comedy soap opera about the royal family returns. Prince Charles refuses to help Theresa May secure a trade deal with the Chinese, but when Camilla withholds his conjugal rights, Charles agrees to host a banquet. Wills wants to be a hands-on dad, mixing with ordinary parents, but comes to realise childcare is a nightmare, while Pippa is preparing to marry Johnny, but is enraged that Kate has been made patron of Wimbledon and decides to put a gypsy curse on her.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats
programme.desc: Irreverent panel show hosted by Jimmy Carr, in which guests join team captains Rob Beckett and Aisling Bea to answer questions based on opinion polls. programme.title: The Paperboy
programme.desc: A reporter returns to his home town to investigate the story of a man on death row for the murder of a sheriff. He enlists the help of his younger brother, who falls in love with a woman infatuated with the condemned man and determined to marry him on his release. Drama set in the 1960s, starring Matthew McConaughey, Zac Efron, Nicole Kidman and John Cusack.(n)

programme.title: The Handmaid's Tale
programme.desc: When a trade delegation from Mexico comes to Gilead, Offred discovers several shocking secrets. Serena Joy reflects on her marriage and the role she played in Gilead's inception. Drama based on the novel by Margaret Atwood and set in the dystopia of Gilead, a totalitarian society in what was formerly part of the United States. Starring Elisabeth Moss and Yvonne Strahovski.(n)

In Jesmond, Newcastle, the team is hired to update a 1940s house, adding a garden office and new kitchen. Engineer Monty Ravenscroft transforms the garden shed with mirrors and LED lighting, while Rosie Bines plants a white garden that can be enjoyed both day and night.(n)

programme.desc: Last-ever episode. With their mission over, the aliens prepare to leave Earth - but Dick finds himself unable to abandon Mary and wonders if she might join him in outer space. John Lithgow, Jane Curtin and Kristen Johnston star.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon and Amy spend Thanksgiving together as friends, while Howard reluctantly agrees to volunteer at a soup kitchen with Bernadette, Raj and Emily.(n)

programme.title: The Big Bang Theory
programme.desc: Sheldon is driven to distraction when a tune becomes stuck in his head, while Amy and Dave arrange another date and Howard and Raj discover their band has a fan, but tracking him down turns out to be a mistake. Comedy, starring Jim Parsons, Mayim Bialik, Simon Helberg and Kunal Nayyar.(n)

programme.desc: Grampa Simpson falls in love with a woman at the rest home who later dies unexpectedly and leaves him $100,000. Understandably taken aback, he does not know what to do with his new-found wealth - but resolves not to share it with Homer.(n)

programme.title: The Simpsons
programme.desc: Grampa is press-ganged into babysitting Bart, Lisa and Maggie while Marge and Homer visit a rural retreat in a bid to save their ailing marriage.(n)

programme.sub-title: Three Men and a Comic Book.
programme.desc: Bart becomes convinced Milhouse and Martin are trying to steal a valuable comic book they all clubbed together to buy. As his paranoia escalates, the three enter into a dangerous confrontation that threatens to end their friendship. With the guest voice of Daniel Stern.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: Gordon Ramsay visits Down City, a restaurant in Providence, Rhode Island. The no-nonsense chef struggles to persuade hot-headed owner Abby to make his suggested changes, and a confrontation results in him being thrown out of the building in the middle of a dinner service. The eatery's co-owner and financier begs Gordon to return, but his success hinges on his ability to win Abby over.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition kicks off at Callum Hogg and Lauren Abraham's modern Park Hotel in Gloucestershire, where sisters Sue Lewis and Wendy Germann are impressed by the colourful decor, but it's not an opinion held by all. The guests are not impressed with having to pay extra for breakfast and Callum and Lauren are faced with robust feedback that leaves them wanting answers and thinking not everyone is being fair.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The second visit is to Trowbridge in Wiltshire to Sue's B&B, which is run by Sue Lewis and her sister, Wendy Germann. Breakfast at the communal table has its awkward moments and Sue is under pressure, having never cooked for so many before. However, it's the feedback that leaves the hosts wondering if maybe some of the guests have not been that straightforward.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The contestants travel to The Talbot in Iwerne Minster, Dorset for the third day of the competition, where hosts Erika Watt and Ellie Gill greet their guests. The rooms do not live up to their good first impression and Callum and Lauren are quick to find fault. At breakfast, tensions simmer as Wendy calls Cameron a creep, and at feedback, some of the comments send Erika and Ellie into fits of giggles.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The fourth visit of the week is to The Old Rectory in Llangattock, south Wales, where young hotel manager Cameron Thomas likes to keep things professional. Despite wanting to find fault, Lauren and Callum are soon to admit their bridal suite is top notch, but Erika and Ellie think there may be some cleaning issues. During an afternoon of canoe racing the group members show their competitive sides.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The guest house owners meet for the last time to find out what they have been paid and to settle some scores. The Park Hotel in Gloucestershire is up first as owners Callum Hogg and Lauren Abraham want to get to the bottom of why Cameron didn't sleep soundly. Next, Sue Lewis from Sue's B&B seeks to discover the deasons for Callum and Lauren's low score for the cleanliness. When all issues are resolved, the winning establishment is revealed.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Winter Sun

programme.desc: Steve Jones presents action from the qualifying session at the Red Bull Ring in Spielberg, where the drivers battled for pole position ahead of the ninth round of the season. Lewis Hamilton was the dominant force at this race last season, claiming pole position in qualifying, recording the fastest lap during the race, and taking the chequered flag to record his fifth victory of the campaign.(n)

programme.title: Rise of the Planet of the Apes

Comedy, with Kristen Wiig, Rose Byrne and Melissa McCarthy.(n)

Wes Craven's suspense thriller, starring Rachel McAdams, Cillian Murphy and Brian Cox.(n)

He ends up facing the same situation again when three malicious teenage girls claim he raped one of them, but resolves to prove his innocence in the face of a witch hunt from the community. Crime drama based on Jodi Picoult's novel, starring James Van Der Beek and Sarah Carter. Edited for daytime broadcast.(n)

programme.sub-title: England v South Africa: First Test Day Two.
programme.desc: England v South Africa. Highlights of the second day's play in the First Test, which took place at Lord's. The Proteas haven't toured England in the longest format of the game since they won a three-game series 2-0 in 2012, with victory sealed by a 51-run triumph in the decisive Third Test on this ground. With commentary by Graeme Smith, Geoffrey Boycott, Simon Hughes, Michael Vaughan and Mark Nicholas.(n)

programme.title: Blind Date
programme.desc: Paul O'Grady seeks a would-be sweetheart for Arnold, who emigrated from Africa to Manchester, and served with the British Army in Afghanistan for nearly five years. Arnold's idea of a perfect date would involve a spin on the London Eye, and Paul gives three ladies a chance to woo the gentlemanly soldier. Meanwhile, finance director Gemma - also from Manchester - seeks an adventurous Prince Charming to settle down and start a family with. Plus, the host catches up with last week's couples, to find out whether that initial spark of attraction could develop into something more.(n)

programme.title: The Best of Bad TV
programme.sub-title: Best of Bad TV: Live & Dangerous.
programme.desc: A collection of major TV howlers, including a fire on the Blue Peter set, famous folk who think they can sing, wardrobe malfunctions and disastrous award shows. There's a lowlight from The National Lottery Jetset as the studio is invaded, Lorraine Kelly being forced off the air, and a wannabe magician impaling the hand of a presenter. Bucks Fizz singer Cheryl Baker has insight into Eurovision's most off-key moments, while John Stapleton recalls The Time, The Place being ambushed. Other contributors include Sarah Cawood, Penny Smith, Dom Joly, Maria McErlane and Matt Johnson.(n)

programme.title: Big Brother
