programme.desc: Dinner at Tiffani's is about to get even better when she invites her good friends Bree Turner, Lance Bass and his husband, Michael Turchin, to breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver focuses on dishes containing onions, garlic and leeks, using them to produce simple meals including a salad, soup, and roast pork with an onion and potato al forno. He also chats to a gardener about the health benefits of raw garlic.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver uses a variety of carrots in an Indian salad, demonstrates how they can be used to complement a pork chop and discovers why the vegetable is orange. He then prepares foil-roasted smoked beetroot with beef and a cottage cheese dressing.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: North West chefs Mary-Ellen McTague, James Durrant and Mark Ellis have one last chance to impress in their attempts to secure a place to cook at a banquet in St Paul's Cathedral marking the 70th anniversary of D-Day. The mystery Great British Menu veteran assesses them and decides which one of the trio will not be returning for the regional final.(n)

programme.title: Great British Menu
programme.desc: The two remaining North West chefs prepare their entire menus for Prue Leith, Matthew Fort, Oliver Peyton and guest judge George Batts, who is a veteran of the Normandy landings. Only one contender can make it through to represent their region in the national finals and get the chance to cook at a banquet held in St Paul's Cathedral to mark the 70th anniversary of D-Day.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond makes an Italian meatloaf, and a no-bake mac and four cheeses, served with a simple green salad, before preparing slice cookies and ice cream sundaes.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree prepares strawberry lemonade and scalloped potatoes and ham with a side of lemony green beans for the family.(n)

programme.title: Extreme Cake Wars
programme.desc: The bakers piece together incredible LEGO-themed cakes, with the winner having their cake at the centre of a massive party at LEGO's flagship store.(n)

programme.title: Kids BBQ Championship
programme.desc: Three contestants enter the barbecue arena, but only one will emerge victorious, winning the title of Kids BBQ Champion.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman visits Burnside Brewing Company, a brewery known for its perfect pairings of home-made beers and delicious bar food.(n)

programme.title: Man Finds Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman visits the country music capital of the world and learns about Pepperfire, a restaurant that makes Nashville-style hot chicken.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Chef Jamie Oliver rustles up simple, seasonal dishes and demonstrates how to cook using home-grown potatoes. Among the dishes on the menu are Spanish omelette and a roast chicken tray bake with tomatoes. Outside in the garden, Brian shows how tasty spuds can be cultivated in the smallest of spaces.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver cooks using peppers and chillies. The menu includes a spicy pork goulash and an experimental dish of smoked salmon with a zingy salsa. He also joins Brian for a taste-test of the hottest chilli in the world - and it is the loyal gardener who keeps his cool.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger Mooking heads to the heart of Alabama to visit The American Barbecue Belt.(n)

programme.title: Man Fire Food
programme.desc: Roger Mooking visits South Carolina for two spectacular low country cookouts, a traditional backyard 'pig pickin', and a classic oyster roast.(n)

programme.title: Jamie & Jimmy's Food Fight Club
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver and Jimmy Doherty travel to Germany to pit British sausages against foreign alternatives, and Jimmy also takes on a stomach-turning food-tasting challenge in the name of science. Hollywood A-lister Gwyneth Paltrow cooks pasta at the pair's seaside cafe in Southend, Essex, where she contends with a food fight involving marshmallows, before joining the duo for a burger and fries on a rollercoaster.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant Stakeout
programme.desc: Willie helps Anthony and Toby, owners of struggling eatery Hot Rods Real Pit BBQ, and finds that bad attitudes and a lack of training are contributing to their lack of success.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: Carl, owner of the Bakehouse Restaurant and Bar in Austin, Texas, fears a dispute between his son and his favourite waitress is threatening the harmony of his establishment, so seeks the team's advice on the best way to proceed.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: After hearing rumours that kegs of his privately brewed beer are showing up at local parties, Rick, owner of Uncle Billy's Brew and Que in Austin, Texas, contacts Charles for help.(n)

programme.title: Bizarre Foods America
programme.desc: Andrew Zimmern explores the driving forces behind the cutting edge food scene in Chicago.(n)

programme.title: Restaurant: Impossible
programme.desc: Chef Robert Irvine is on a mission to save the Georgia Boy Cafe in Hagerstown, Maryland from failure in just two days and with a budget of only $10,000.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: The team help the owner of Catharsis restaurant, Miami, as they have recently received complaints of theft and inappropriate behaving during a Dining in the Dark event.(n)

programme.title: Mystery Diners
programme.desc: A pub owner in Los Angeles uses undercover surveillance to spy on a worker who she suspects is over-pouring for customers and giving away too many free drinks.(n)

programme.title: Teleshopping
programme.desc: A chance to buy goods from the comfort of home.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten prepares barbecue ribs, potato salad and blue cheese coleslaw.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten demonstrates the versatility of pasta, preparing a lasagne, a pesto salad, and a penne and five-cheese special.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: American writer Ina Garten creates a lunch box after receiving a gift of herbs from her friend.(n)

programme.title: Barefoot Contessa
programme.desc: Ina Garten reveals how to create delicious dishes without spending hours at the stove, preparing a chicken pie and split pea soup.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond prepares chicken nachos two-ways for the family to eat after the homecoming parade. Then she's off to her boys' football game armed with chocolate chunk cookies.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.sub-title: Stacking the Hay and Stocking the Freezer.
programme.desc: While the family stacks hay, Ree Drummond stocks up the freezer with dishes including chicken enchiladas, pizza pockets, three cheese stuffed shells, and purple smoothie popsicles.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: Ree Drummond spills the cocoa beans on her love for chocolate, including Ladd's chocolate pie, chocolate message cookies, chocolate fondue, and chocolate covered potato chips.(n)

programme.title: The Pioneer Woman
programme.desc: While the family ships cattle, Ree Drummond gets ahead with dinner and whips up a breakfast of a pancake bar with oven fried bacon, strawberries, and vanilla bean caramel sauce.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef looks for things to do with pumpkins other than turning them into traditional Halloween lanterns. Recipes include a roast duck and pumpkin winter salad with Asian dressing, a soup and a lighter snack - squash fairy cakes.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef serves up home-grown winter salad dishes, including a bagna cauda, a herb omelette, and a Japanese-style tuna sashimi with sprouting herb salad and a surprising dressing. Meanwhile, gardener Brian experiments with seeds to demonstrate the full array of colourful, tasty ingredients available in the cold, dark months.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver rustles up more simple dishes using home-grown produce. He is joined by a Welsh sheep farmer who tackles common misconceptions about lamb and explains how the conditions the animals are kept in affects the quality of the meat.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares recipes using leeks, including pappardelle and a `concertina' squid dish. He also explains why the underrated vegetables can be a real asset in the kitchen and offers advice on how to grow and store them.(n)

programme.title: Jamie at Home
programme.desc: The chef serves simple recipes using winter vegetables grown in his Essex garden. He prepares a seasonal coleslaw and bubble and squeak, and uses homegrown cabbage to make an Italian soup.(n)

programme.title: Jamie Does
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver visits the villages surrounding Toulouse in the French Pyrenees, an area renowned for its artisan food. He goes truffle-hunting and prepares an omelette with the pickings, learns how to make bread in the traditional way, and joins locals for a wild boar hunt. The chef also shows how to prepare tarte Tatin, Roquefort salad, confit of duck and a country-style terrine.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: At New York's Port Royal Pub and Grille, Adam Richman tackles the Davy Jones Locker Challenge, a huge platter of seafood that only one person has ever finished.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: In Oklahoma City, Adam Richman takes on a challenge in which he must eat 29 deep-fried catfish fillets.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman tries the Ultimate Destroyer Challenge at Papa Bob's Bar-B-Que in Kansas City, where he must eat a foot-long sandwich containing 5lb of smoked meat in 45 minutes.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman travels to Indianapolis to try the Big Ugly Burger Challenge at Bub's Burger Ice Cream.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman visits New Jersey to take on the Ludicrous Wings challenge - consuming 12 super spicy hot wings in 15 minutes or less.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: In Syracuse, New York, Adam Richman takes on the Frittata Challenge - a breakfast dish weighing more than 6lb.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman visits Portland, Maine, where he attempts the Manimal Challenge to eat a 4lb meal in 20 minutes or less.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman's journey takes him to Niagara Falls, where he takes on an Italian food challenge that includes 10 plates of food that must be eaten in 90 minutes.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman's culinary quest for the best traditional food takes him to Butte, Montana, where he takes on the Jumboli challenge - which means he must eat a 5lb stromboli.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: In Sacramento, California, Adam Richman takes on the Knucklehead Challenge - 5lb of chilli-smothered hot dogs.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman tries to finish the 5lb Adam Emmenecker sandwich in 15 minutes at Jethro's BBQ in Des Moines, Iowa.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman visits Knoxville, Tennessee, where he must take on the Gigante Burrito Challenge at Sweet P's BBQ.(n)

programme.title: Man v Food
programme.desc: Adam Richman tries to consume 5lb of nachos in 45 minutes in the Mount Nacheesmo challenge in Ann Arbor, Michigan.(n)

programme.title: The Thin Blue Line
programme.desc: Grim tracks down criminal carol singers, and Fowler falls victim to the ruthless Gasforth Amateur Dramatics Society. Goody, meanwhile, discovers giving presents to colleagues is not guaranteed to create goodwill. Festive instalment of the comedy from 1995, starring Rowan Atkinson and David Haig.(n)

programme.title: Sorry
programme.desc: Timothy is evicted from the family home for destroying his parents' car, but he finds that is only the beginning of his troubles.(n)

programme.title: As Time Goes By
programme.desc: Jean pays an unexpected visit during Lionel's lecture tour - only to be surprised herself. Comedy, starring Judi Dench and Geoffrey Palmer.(n)

programme.title: One Foot in the Grave
programme.desc: The Meldrew household echoes to the sound of laughter, as Margaret joins the local amateur dramatic society and Victor begins penning a sitcom script. However, his mother-in-law's bath-time accident and a run-in with British Telecom soon leave the curmudgeonly codger in no mood for jokes. Comedy, starring Richard Wilson and Annette Crosbie.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg, Truly, Alvin and Billy encounter a stranger who is determined to travel by canal to Ilkley in an inflatable swan. However, when punctures disrupt the man's dream, Entwistle is on hand to ensure the voyage goes to plan. Tommy Cannon and Bobby Ball guest star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Clegg climbs a tree to prove a point, but finds getting down is not as easy. Meanwhile, the police investigate the case of a runaway cooker. Comedy, starring Peter Sallis.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: Has Anyone Seen a Peruvian Wart?.
programme.desc: Roy Barraclough guest stars as Crowcroft, a well-known Lothario with a preference for gullible women. When he samples Nora Batty's baking, he decides to make her his next target. Long-running comedy, with Kathy Staff, Peter Sallis and Frank Thornton.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates decide on a wager as the parole board gathers, with Blanco odds-on favourite for release. However, the old lag turns down his freedom and leaves Fletcher in danger of losing a small fortune. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.desc: Tom's philosophy of life gains him two eager disciples - but he is soon anxious to be rid of them. Comedy, starring Richard Briers and Felicity Kendal.(n)

programme.title: Mrs Brown's Boys
programme.desc: Agnes becomes concerned when Dermot announces he wants to ask his childhood friend Buster, a known criminal, to be his best man. However, she is distracted when her neighbour Winnie's husband is rushed to hospital, leaving her son trying to raise funds for his wedding by getting embroiled in a money-making scheme.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: Richie and Eddie hear of a sure-fire way to make a lot of money on a horse race, but it isn't long before their plan lands them in trouble with the police, the local landlord and a one-legged Falklands veteran. Slapstick comedy, starring Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: The pals look forward to celebrating Christmas, but an unexpected guest disrupts their plans as Richie suffers delusions of grandeur and the whole spirit of the festive season is jeopardised. Anarchic comedy, starring Adrian Edmondson and Rik Mayall.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: After inheriting £600 the duo head off for a night at the fair. Richie's wallet is stolen, but that proves to be the least of his problems as a fortune teller declares that he is going to die in three nights' time. Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson star.(n)

programme.title: Bottom
programme.desc: Eddie and Richie agree to mind their landlord's shop - and end up irritating the locals so much they find themselves facing a gang of looters. John Wells guest stars, alongside Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson as the puerile flatmates.(n)

programme.title: The Mighty Boosh
programme.desc: Several animals and one of the zookeepers disappear, so Howard and Vince set out to solve the mystery, uncovering a secret laboratory where Dixon Bainbridge is performing diabolical experiments. Comedy, starring Noel Fielding and Julian Barratt.(n)

programme.title: The Mighty Boosh
programme.desc: The zoo's oldest gorilla falls gravely ill, so Bob persuades Howard to dress in an ape suit so he can collect sponsorship money on its behalf. Howard proves so convincing he even fools the Grim Reaper, who hauls him off to Ape Hell.(n)

programme.title: Spaced
programme.desc: Tim's ex-girlfriend announces she wants him back, putting his flatshare with Daisy in peril. Meanwhile, Marsha becomes suspicious of how close Twist is getting to Brian, and Mike faces a fitness test to evaluate his chances of getting back into the Territorial Army. Comedy, starring Simon Pegg, Jessica Hynes and Mark Heap.(n)

programme.title: Spaced
programme.desc: Daisy returns from Asia with sinister government agents shadowing her every move. To make matters worse, Tim has found himself another flatmate. Comedy, starring Jessica Hynes and Simon Pegg, with John Simm, Mark Gatiss and Kevin Eldon.(n)

programme.title: Big Train
programme.desc: Comic skits and sketches from the award-winning show, including Adolf Hitler taking his first book to the publisher and a group of armoured knights with an unusual request. Kevin Eldon, Rebecca Front, Mark Heap and Tracy-Ann Oberman star.(n)

programme.sub-title: The Lair of the Cat Creature.
programme.desc: A hang-gliding enthusiast crashes down in the village, mistakenly believing that he's landed in France, thus breaking the long-distance record. The gang tries to compensate for his disappointment by making him the best at something else - identifying a strange cat creature lurking in the woods. Peter Sallis, Frank Thornton and Brian Murphy star.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.desc: Truly and Clegg are enlightened in the wisdom of the East by an electrical handyman from Hull, and Howard struggles to keep his self-styled bandit persona alive. Meanwhile, a debt-collector is an unwelcome guest for Tom.(n)

programme.title: Last of the Summer Wine
programme.sub-title: A Pick-Up of the Later Ming Dynasty.
programme.desc: After helping Entwistle repair his truck, Truly, Clegg and Billy find their mechanical skills are put to the test once more when they help Tom and Smiler locate the source of an irritating squeak on their handcart. However, when Barry's longed-for game of golf evaporates thanks to his borrowed car breaking down, all the trio can do is help him drown his sorrows.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Harris accidentally drops stolen pills into Fletcher's midday cuppa - much to the annoyance of prison racketeer Harry Grout, who resents a newcomer muscling in on his patch. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletcher objects to having a third cellmate foisted on him, especially as the newcomer seems to enjoy special privileges and the full backing of the wardens. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates are shocked to discover there is a thief in their midst, so Fletcher decides to stage a mock trial to bring the culprit to justice with the help of Slade's resident legal consultant Judge Rawley. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, Richard Beckinsale and Maurice Denham.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: The inmates decide on a wager as the parole board gathers, with Blanco odds-on favourite for release. However, the old lag turns down his freedom and leaves Fletcher in danger of losing a small fortune. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Godber starts work on another O-level course, but wily old cellmate Fletcher can't understand why he doesn't just cheat in the exam. Prison comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch tries to ensure that Godber has not blown his chances of early release after he gets into a fight a week before his parole board hearing. Final episode of the classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Crafty con Fletcher helps new inmate Godber settle in by giving him a few lessons on coping with prison life. First episode of the classic comedy, originally broadcast in 1974, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Betting fever sweeps Slade Prison, but the stakes rise too high for some of the inmates, stretching honour among thieves to the limit. Vintage comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and Richard Beckinsale.(n)

programme.title: Porridge
programme.desc: Fletch plans to bring a bit of Christmas spirit to Slade Prison in the form of his own home-made booze. But when Mackay and Barraclough uncover the stash in his cell, the crafty con seems in danger of spending the yuletide period in solitary confinement. Festive edition of the classic comedy from 1976, starring Ronnie Barker and Fulton Mackay.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Tight-fisted shopkeeper Arkwright purchases fire-damaged stock, only to find all the tins have lost their labels, and the only way to discover their contents is to open them. Roy Clarke's classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Following a break-in, Arkwright buys a dog to keep away potential burglars. Unfortunately, his new investment also scares off the customers. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: Miserly shopkeeper Arkwright organises a sales drive in a bid to boost profits - and rid himself of the vast consignment of apples he has mistakenly ordered. An unhappy Granville is persuaded to demonstrate the merchandise. Classic comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.sub-title: An Errand Boy by the Ear.
programme.desc: Arkwright's regular customers are upset by his habit of continually dragging Granville around by the ear in an attempt to toughen him up. Roy Clarke's comedy, starring Ronnie Barker, David Jason and Stephanie Cole.(n)

programme.title: Open All Hours
programme.desc: A man who emigrated to Australia decades earlier, and was known to have a soft spot for Nurse Gladys Emmanuel, plans to pay a return visit to his former haunts - making Arkwright fear that he will try to rekindle old passions. Comedy, starring Ronnie Barker and David Jason.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville and Gastric try to get Madge into the festive spirit by organising a cosy drinks party. Meanwhile, a bargain Christmas tree causes problems, Nurse Gladys discusses tactics for her new job with Mrs Featherstone and Eric and Cyril attempt to impress their wives with a healthy living plan. Christmas edition of the comedy, starring David Jason, Lynda Baron and Tim Healy.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville organises a cut-price sale - but only as a means to get rid of old stock - while Nurse Gladys is reunited with a former patient. Romance is in the air in the neighbourhood, as Mrs Featherstone has her eye on a new arrival while Mavis tries to reignite Granville's passion over a cup of coffee.(n)

programme.title: Still Open All Hours
programme.desc: Granville discovers a gap in the shop's security, and Madge is made anxious by a cherry picker - while a neighbour's home cooking threatens the penny-pinching shopkeeper's plans to matchmake her and Gastric. Meanwhile, Eric and Kath make plans to spend some time together.(n)

programme.title: The Young Ones
programme.desc: The four students decide to throw a party, but before long it descends into chaos. Rick desperately tries to impress his favourite lecturer, Mike chats up a fairytale princess, Vyvyan's fellow punks start a riot, and Neil gets beaten up, while other guests include the four horsemen of the Apocalypse, a giant sandwich, a singing tomato and Santa. Comedy first broadcast in 1982, starring Rik Mayall and Adrian Edmondson, with music by Rip Rig and Panic.(n)

programme.title: The Young Ones
programme.desc: Mr Balowski becomes a mad axeman and chases the bachelor boys into Narnia as a flood of biblical proportions engulfs London. Anarchic comedy, starring Rik Mayall, Adrian Edmondson, Nigel Planer and Christopher Ryan.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef: The Professionals
programme.desc: Four of the eight chefs from the previous heat return to face a skills test in which they must each debone a saddle of lamb and then roll and tie it ready for roasting. Michel Roux Jr then challenges them to recreate his recipe for mackerel tartlet with chive beurre blanc, before the contenders prepare their own choice of classic dish to be judged by Michel and Monica Galetti, who pick three to advance to the quarter-final.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Bake Off
programme.desc: Another chance to see the 2012 contest, as presenters Mel Giedroyc and Sue Perkins invite 12 enthusiastic bakers to take part in a contest to determine which of them is Britain's best amateur, facing challenges devised by judges Mary Berry and Paul Hollywood. To begin with, they tackle an upside down cake, before following Paul's recipe for rum babas, a hybrid of cake and enriched dough that baffles some of the competitors. Finally, they are challenged to produce a show-stopping cake that reveals a hidden design when sliced into. Who will be first to leave?.(n)

programme.title: MasterChef
programme.desc: John Torode and Gregg Wallace present the penultimate heat. The six hopefuls begin by dishing up their calling card, a single plate of food showcasing their talent in the kitchen, followed by the invention test, in which the ingredients include rhubarb, lime, pomegranate and popping candy, or pollock, sausages, Parmesan and quail's eggs. After two cooks are sent home, things get serious, with the rest preparing a two-course dinner for 2007 MasterChef winner Steven Wallis, as well as Sara Danesin and Alex Rushmer, finalists from 2011 and 2010 respectively. It's then down to the judges to decide which two will advance to Friday's quarter-final.(n)

programme.title: Hairy Bikers' Best of British
programme.desc: Si King and Dave Myers create classic puddings and explore the history and traditions behind Britain's favourite desserts. They also take part in the world black-pudding throwing competition in Lancashire.(n)

programme.title: Ottolenghi's Mediterranean Feast
programme.desc: Chef Yotam Ottolenghi explores the island of Sardinia, beginning in the fishing port of Bosa where he prepares one of the Mediterranean's greatest meals - freshly caught lobster roasted on an open fire. He then travels inland to share a meal of spit-roasted lamb accompanied with a salad of figs and radicchio with three generations of shepherds. Finally, while on a mountain top at dawn, he learns the secret of producing silky soft cheese for a dessert of ricotta fritters drizzled with golden honey and orange zest.(n)

programme.title: John Torode's Australia
programme.desc: In the first of a two-part episode filmed in Queensland, the MasterChef judge prepares lunch for lifeguards by the Great Barrier Reef, and goes spear-fishing for crabs.(n)

programme.title: James Martin: Yorkshire's Finest
programme.desc: James takes a trip to York market, where he rustles up broccoli and almond soup, chicken with mustard spring greens and lemon syllabub.(n)

programme.title: James Martin: Yorkshire's Finest
programme.desc: The chef travels to Masham in North Yorkshire, where he prepares haunch of venison with asparagus, and cauliflower cheese.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver prepares roast shoulder of lamb with all the trimmings, before turning the leftovers into Moroccan-style crispy pastillas, and makes good use of stale bread by using it as part of a panzanella salad. The chef also shows a lover of takeaways how to dish up a beef rendang from the remains of a cut of brisket, and helps two people reduce their food waste.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates wallet-friendly recipes for pot-roasted ham hocks, squash and spinach rotolo, and steak and chips, and shows a takeaway lover how to make sweet and sour fish balls for a fraction of the price of her favourite Chinese treat. The chef also inspires a pair of food wasters to make good use of all their leftover salad.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver demonstrates how to prepare nutritious meals for around £1.55 a portion. He cooks up a roast side of salmon with all the trimmings and uses the leftovers in a filo pie, before showing a takeaway lover how to make a lamb burger for a fraction of the price of his usual Friday night fast-food treat. Plus, a woman receives tips on putting unwanted bread to good use.(n)

programme.title: Jamie's Money Saving Meals
programme.desc: Jamie Oliver rustles up a frugal paella with chicken thighs, spicy chorizo and prawns, and uses leftovers from a Sunday roast pork to make midweek crispy Mexican tacos and French Vietnamese banh mi. Plus, Sicilian-inspired meatballs and tomato `Norma' sauce and a twist on beans on toast with broad beans and peas from the freezer. The chef also demonstrates how to reap the benefits of a well-stocked store cupboard.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef continues his exploration of the Far East's most diverse food cultures, travelling to Penang, Malaysia, to sample its multifaceted cuisine, which includes Malay, Indian, Chinese and British flavours. He also meets food writer Fay Khoo to explore the popularity of the region's fish-head curry, before crossing the Indian Ocean to Sri Lanka, where he visits a bustling fishing village and takes part in an unusual expedition.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The seafood chef continues to explore the Far East's most diverse food cultures with a visit to Sri Lanka, where he discovers a wealth of hot and spicy vegetable curries. He then ventures on to Bali and finds food has a religious significance on the island, before sampling what he believes is the best roast pork he has ever tasted.(n)

programme.title: Rick Stein's Far Eastern Odyssey
programme.desc: The chef ends his exploration of the Far East's most diverse food cultures by visiting Bangladesh, sampling the curry on offer in the country that has played a major role in establishing the success of Indian restaurants throughout the UK.(n)

programme.sub-title: Mario Batali, Ray Lewis, Rohan Marley
programme.desc: Mario Batali, Ray Lewis, Rohan Marley. Football legend Ray Lewis and his best friend Rohan Marley join Mario Batali for a meal inspired by Rohan's Jamaican roots and Ray's childhood in Florida(n)

programme.title: Huang's World
programme.desc: Istanbul. Eddie travels to Istanbul, where he samples the region's diverse cuisines and experiences the changing religious landscape of a once cosmopolitan society(n)

programme.title: Huang's World
programme.desc: Toronto. Eddie checks out Toronto by embedding himself in a handful of immigrant communities to better understand how ethnic food flourishes under the support of multiculturalism(n)

programme.title: Whiplash
programme.desc: An invalid, disabled in the ring, lives vicariously through his wife's paramour by training him to be a championship boxer(n)

programme.title: Whiplash
programme.desc: An invalid, disabled in the ring, lives vicariously through his wife's paramour by training him to be a championship boxer(n)

programme.title: The Therapist
programme.desc: Freddie Gibbs. In the series premiere, rapper Freddie Gibbs discusses being falsely accused and incarcerated for rape and how he's managed to recover from the troubling experience(n)

programme.title: The Therapist
programme.desc: Joey Bada$$. Joey Bada$$ grapples with the suicide of friend and fellow rapper Capital Steez(n)

programme.title: The Therapist
programme.desc: DRAM. D.R.A.M. discusses how the absence of his father, his string of odd jobs, and his spontaneity has led to his success in the rap world(n)

programme.title: Next Day Air
programme.desc: An overnight shipment of drugs winds up being sent to the wrong recipient, prompting a frantic race to recover the package before the contents are discovered in this fast-paced crime comedy starring Donald Faison, Mos Def, and Mike Epps. When Brody (Epps) and Guch (Wood Harris) received package containing 10 kilos of grade-A cocaine, they assumed their financial woes were a thing of the past. The package was intended for their Brody and Guch's next-door neighbors, but the whacked-out courier (Donald Faison) delivered it to the wrong address. Recognizing the possibility for profit, the scheming duo plans to sell the cocaine to Brody's drug-dealing cousin (Omari Hardwick). Meanwhile Jesus (Cisco Reyes) and his girlfriend Chita (Yasmin Deliz), the intended recipients of the cocaine, set out to procure the package before notorious drug lord Bodego Diablo (Emilio Rivera) realizes it's gone missing. But Bodega is no slouch; he already knows the shipment was botched, and he's determined to get his drugs back no matter what the cost. Later, as Brody and Guch prepare to seal the deal that will set them up for life, the guns are drawn and the chaos begins(n)

programme.title: Risky Business
programme.desc: A teenager with a bright future turns his house into a brothel while his parents are away, falls for a prostitute and earns the wrath of Guido the Killer Pimp in this comedy highlighted by Tom Cruise's star-making performance(n)

programme.title: The Man Without a Face
programme.desc: Mel Gibson plays a disfigured outcast who forms a close bond with an emotionally neglected 12-year-old(n)

programme.title: Tracey Ullman's Show
programme.desc: Epsiode 5. Kate Middleton's mother babysits Prince George; Maggie Smith mulls an action movie franchise; a zookeeper misses her favourite monkey; American tourists see a darker side of Britain; a vicar is late for a funeral and turns to social media for help(n)

programme.title: Ready to Rumble
programme.desc: Can two inept amateurs help a fading wrestling star make a comeback? A veteran professional wrestler (Oliver Platt) is no longer winning matches, thus disappointing his fans, especially a pair of grappling enthusiasts (David Arquette and Scott Caan) who regard the aging fighter as their hero. They come up with what they believe is a foolproof plan to put their favorite fighter back on top: they'll pose as a wrestling tag team, stage a match with their favorite, lose in a truly embarrassing manner, and thus clear the way for his comeback. But is returning to the top of the card really this simple? Ready to Rumble also features Martin Landau and Rose McGowan, with several stars from the WCW professional wrestling league playing themselves, including Bill Goldberg(n)

programme.title: Lady in the Water
programme.desc: Downtrodden caretaker Cleveland Heep is drawn into a dangerous world of 'narfs' and 'scrunts' by Story, an ethereal sea nymph who appears in the residents' pool(n)

programme.desc: A talented, young writer and a respected editor develop a bond that's more than normal friendship. There is warmth, there are complications and there is something that will change their lives forever(n)

programme.desc: A bookish boy is bewitched by the new girl in his South Carolina town, but she and her family hide a powerful and magical secret. Fantasy(n)

programme.title: Flipped
programme.desc: Mischievous schoolboy Bryce realises that the girl he has struggled to avoid may be his one true love. Over the course of six years, Juli pines for Bryce, who does everything in his power to put her off. Later, as the pair enter high school, Bryce discovers girls and realises his true feelings for Juli(n)

programme.title: Making of 'War for the Planet of the Apes'
programme.desc: A look at "War for the Planet of the Apes," a 2017 thriller about an ape army's struggle against homo sapiens. The film stars Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn, and is directed by Matt Reeves(n)

programme.title: The Secret of the Magic Gourd
programme.desc: Wonderful blend of live action and CGI animation telling the amazing coming-of-age tale of a lazy young boy (Zhu Oi Long) who discovers an enchanted fruit that has the power to grant wishes and give him anything his heart desires. But soon the magic gourd begins to drive the lad out of his gourd. Gigi Leung, Peisi Chen. Directed by John Chu and Frankie Chung, and written by Chu and Lam Kee To, who adapted the popular 1958 kids' book by Zhang Tianyi(n)

programme.title: Dr. Seuss' Horton Hears a Who!
programme.desc: (2008) Jimmy Hayward and Steve Martino's animated family film, based on Dr Seuss' book, stars Horton (voiced by Jim Carrey), a elephant. One day, wandering through the jungle, he hears a voice coming from a mote of dust. It turns out to be the tiny planet of the Whos, who are threatened with destruction. Horton agrees to help them and, catching them safely on a flower, seeks the help of the others in the jungle. But the Kangaroo, ruler of the jungle, believes, "If you can't see it, it's not there" and hires the vulture Vlad to eliminate the planet. Can Horton save the Whos? With Steve Carrell as the voice of the Mayor of Whoville, and Isla Fisher as a Who doctor, Mary Lou Larue(n)

programme.title: Sesame Street
programme.desc: Twinkle Twinkle Little Elmo. Elmo practices the piano until he can play "Twinkle, Twinkle, Little Star."(n)

programme.title: Sesame Street
programme.desc: The Camouflage Show. Elmo, Rosita and Chris attempt to find six camouflaged things on Sesame Street so they can join the Camouflage Club(n)

programme.title: Inkheart
programme.desc: Brendan Fraser, Paul Bettany and Andy Serkis star in Iain Softley's CGI fantasy adventure about a man with an extraordinary talent, and the consequences of using it. Mo Folchart is a 'silvertongue': someone who can bring characters from the pages of novels into physical being in the real world. But it's a gift he does his best to hide, because each time he brings a fictional character to life, the vacuum created within the written work must be filled by a real person, which is how his wife Resa vanished, after he manifested three ne'er-do-wells from a story. At first he refuses to help one of them, Dustfinger. But then Dustfinger teams up with Capricorn, who plans to force Mo to use his talents to provide him with gargantuan wealth and power. So Mo and his daughter Meggie must set out to thwart the villains and rescue their loved ones from literary purgatory. Also starring Helen Mirren and Jim Broadbent(n)

programme.title: The Words That Built America
programme.desc: Documents written by the Founding Fathers—the Declaration of Independence, the U.S. Constitution and the Bill of Rights—are read by living presidents and vice presidents, members of Congress, diplomats, celebrities and middle-school students from the United Nations International School. David McCullough narrates(n)

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: After a family tragedy, a boy follows a series of clues that lead him to a mysterious orphanage on a remote Welsh island. There, he discovers a community of children with unusual abilities(n)

programme.title: Loving
programme.desc: Biopic about Virginian interracial couple Richard and Mildred Loving, whose arrest in 1958 for violating the state's miscegenation laws eventually led to a landmark Supreme Court decision(n)

programme.title: The Nice Guys
programme.desc: A pair of detectives stumble upon a sprawling conspiracy while investigating the alleged suicide of a once-prominent female porn star(n)

programme.title: Mr. Woodcock
programme.desc: A self-help author comes home for a visit and finds his mother engaged to his sadistic former gym teacher in this crude farce(n)

programme.title: Popstar: Never Stop Never Stopping
programme.desc: This mockumentary satire of the music business and modern celebrity centers on self-absorbed pop rapper Conner4Real (Andy Samberg). Once a member of a popular rap trio called the Style Boyz, Conner is now a solo artist about to drop his second album. Unfortunately, the release gets abysmal reviews, and his career begins to melt down when his attempts at rehabing his image lead to such disasters as a global blackout and a proposal to his girlfriend interrupted by a wolf attack. Eventually, Conner considers burying the hatchet with former colleagues Owen (Jorma Taccone) and Lawrence (Akiva Schaffer) in order to reunite the Style Boyz. Tim Meadows, Maya Rudolph, Sarah Silverman, and Imogen Poots co-star. Samberg, Taccone, and Schaffer co-wrote the screenplay, while Taccone and Schaffer shared directing duties(n)

programme.title: Tour de Pharmacy
programme.desc: Sports-doping spoof focusing on a fictional, world-class cycling event in 1982 that was marred by one controversy after another, as recalled by five riders, commentators, celebrities and other assorted ne'er-do-wells(n)

programme.title: The Boss
programme.desc: A hugely successful businesswoman is convicted of insider trading and sentenced to prison. After being released, she tries to earn redemption by helping a group of young girls in their quest to sell brownies(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Straight Outta Compton'
programme.desc: A look at "Straight Outta Compton," a 2015 drama that chronicles the history of the hip-hop group NWA in 1980s California. The film stars Jason Mitchell, Corey Hawkins, O'Shea Jackson Jr., Aldis Hodge and Neil Brown Jr., and is directed by F. Gary Gray(n)

programme.title: Straight Outta Compton
programme.desc: Entrenched in the racial tumult of Los Angeles in the mid-1980's, a group of aspiring rappers banded together to revolutionize the global consumption of hip-hop and popular culture. NWA was born out of racial frustration and the disadvantaged economics of their South Central neighborhood. F. Gary Gray directs this biopic about the rise to stardom for the act that earned the moniker of "The World's Most Dangerous Group", featuring Ice Cube's son O'Shea Jackson Jr. playing the role of his father, Corey Hawkins as Dr. Dre, and Jason Mitchell as the late Eazy-E(n)

programme.title: Broadcast News
programme.desc: Intelligent romantic comedy which satirises American television news. A highly-strung news producer finds herself strangely attracted to a vapid anchorman, even though she loathes everything he personifies. To make matters worse, her best friend, a talented but unphotogenic news reporter, is secretly in love with her(n)

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen
programme.desc: Sean Connery stars in this all-action adventure as Allan Quatermain, called out of retirement in Kenya to help the government avert a world war being fermented by master criminal The Phantom. Quatermain gathers together a top team; Dorian Gray, Captain Nemo, Mina Harker and The Invisible Man are among those recruited, each with a spectacular skill. From Venice to the wastes of Mongolia, the team face perils and death in their desperate race against time. Stephen Norrington's fantasy, set in an alternative Victorian world, is frantic fun-filled action from start to finish, with the witty script matching awesome special effects(n)

programme.title: Crimson Peak
programme.desc: A mysterious stranger woos and transports a young woman to a crumbling dwelling atop a clay mountain, where she soon learns he has many secrets in the haunted mansion that will leave her fighting for her sanity and her very life(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: In this slick, slam-bang sequel mismatched cops head to Paris to unravel a plot by Triad gangs to assassinate a Chinese diplomat(n)

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: Two down-on-their-luck pals become arms dealers, but get in over their heads when they land a $300 million contract with the U.S. government to supply weaponry to forces in Afghanistan. This raucous comedy-drama is based on true events(n)

programme.title: The Breakfast Club
programme.desc: Forced to spend a Saturday detention in school, five disparate high school kids find that they have more in common than they ever realized. Romantic comedy drama staring Emilio Estevez. (1985)(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Sam and his girlfriend race against time to save the planet from an ancient Decepticon named The Fallen while Optimus Prime and the Autobots work with the military to eliminate the remaining Decepticons(n)

programme.title: Oz
programme.desc: The Routine. The premiere episode of HBO's Oz, directed by Darnell Martin (I Like It Like That), gives viewers an idea of the kind of graphic violence and deviant behavior they can expect from the series. Augustus Hill (Harold Perrineau), a wheelchair-bound convict, serves as the narrator, providing a dark philosophical overview to the action. He introduces many of the characters, giving their names, serial numbers, crime, and sentence while a brief flashback of the crime plays. Tobias Beecher (Lee Tergesen) is out of his element, even in the seemingly safer experimental rehabilitation unit known as "Emerald City," run by well-intentioned control freak Tim McManus (Terry Kinney). Beecher is a former attorney who has been sentenced to 15 years for vehicular manslaughter. Beecher is introduced to his sponsor, Dino Ortolani (Jon Seda), a hot-tempered thug who's connected to Oz's resident Mob boss, Nino Schibetta (Tony Musante). Every new prisoner in "Em City" gets a sponsor, who's supposed to help him adjust, but Ortolani has no use for Beecher, so when Beecher's cellmate, Simon Adebisi (Adewale Akinnouye-Agbaje), starts shaking him down, he's on his own. Vern Schillinger (J.K. Simmons) takes an interest, suggesting Beecher ask McManus for a transfer to another cell. Beecher gratefully takes Schillinger's advice, and ends up bunking with him. Then Beecher finds out that his new cellmate runs the Aryan Brotherhood. "You're mine now," Schillinger tells him. He later burns a swastika tattoo into Beecher's buttocks. Ortolani, meanwhile, has his own problems. A hood he shot, Ryan O'Reily (Dean Winters), gets sent to Oz, but Schibetta warns Ortolani against taking revenge. Ortolani also beats a gay prisoner who comes on to him. The cagey O'Reily convinces the gay man's brother, the leader of Emerald City's gangbangers, Jefferson Keane (Leon), to team up with him to arrange for Ortolani's murder(n)

programme.title: Oz
programme.desc: Conjugal Visits and Otherwise. Beecher receives a conjugal visit from his wife, but it may be his last because the governor wants to end the privilege; Glynn and Schibetta both react to the assault on Ortolani(n)

programme.title: Oz
programme.desc: God's Chillin'. "Being in a gang is a lot like being in a religion," sayeth Hill, and as tension between the gangstas and wiseguys mounts religion finds its way into Em City. Meanwhile, Beecher finds something else to believe in: drugs(n)

programme.title: Oz
programme.desc: Capital P. The governor reinstates capital punishment---just in time for Jefferson Keane to be sentenced to death for the Martinez killing(n)

programme.title: Oz
programme.desc: Straight Life. As Glynn cracks down on drugs, the wiseguys and homies merge their operations. Meanwhile, the McManus-Wittlesey relationship intensifies(n)

programme.title: Oz
programme.desc: To Your Health. A basketball star who was convicted of assault and attempted rape arrives at Em City. Meanwhile, Rebadow is beaten and Ricardo Alvarez is diagnosed with Alzheimer's(n)

programme.title: Oz
programme.desc: Plan B. While Schillinger and Said (J.K. Simmons, Eamonn Walker) recover, rumors of a planned Muslim riot prompt a shakedown at Em City. Meanwhile, there's another new arrival: a classical cellist (Zuill Bailey) who stabbed a violinist to death with the tip of his bow(n)

programme.title: Oz
programme.desc: A Game of Checkers. Tensions at the Oswald State Penitentiary come to a head in the finale of Oz's first season. After being attacked by Beecher (Lee Tergesen), Schillinger (J.K. Simmons) returns to Em City, telling a skeptical McManus (Terry Kinney) that he's a changed man, and will not seek revenge. Schillinger (J.K. Simmons) is concerned about the well-being of his two teenage sons, and plans to behave himself so he'll have a shot at parole. Beecher provokes him, and lets him know he'll try to foul up his plans. McManus confronts Diane Wittlesey (Edie Falco) when he catches her smuggling cigarettes to Schillinger's pal, Scott Ross (Stephen Gevedon). She tells Ross that it's over, but he threatens to go to the warden if she stops supplying him. In the wake of Groves' (Sean Whitesell) murder of a guard, prisoners have been beaten without cause, and many guards have been suspended. Understaffed, the guards in Em City find themselves overpowered when a riot breaks out. Guards are beaten and taken hostage, as is Father Mukada (B.D. Wong). Dobbins (Zuill Bailey), the cellist, is brutally stabbed during the riot, and Hill (Harold Perrineau) persuades a remorseful Mayhew (Rick Fox) to bring the wounded man out of Em City. Said (Eamonn Walker), Alvarez (Kirk Acevedo), Ross, and Adebisi (Adewale Akinnouye-Agbaje) form a fragile alliance to control their respective groups, and come up with a list of demands. McManus tries to assuage his feelings of guilt by offering himself as a hostage in exchange for two wounded guards. Meanwhile, Glynn (Ernie Hudson) finds the prisoners' demands for the restoration of conjugal visits and smoking privileges quite reasonable, but Governor Devlin (Zeljko Ivanek) refuses to negotiate, and calls in the National Guard(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie'
programme.desc: A look at "Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie," a 2016 adaptation of the popular British sitcom about hard-living ladies Edina and Patsy, who flee to the French Riviera after they accidentally cause the death of a celebrity at a posh party. The film stars Jennifer Saunders and Joanna Lumley, and is directed by Mandie Fletcher(n)

programme.title: The Blues Brothers
programme.desc: Brothers try to raise money for a Chicago orphanage by getting their blues band back together(n)

programme.title: The Chronicles of Narnia: The Lion, the Witch and the Wardrobe
programme.desc: . .. The Lion, The Witch And The Wardrobe: The door opens on CS Lewis's magical saga when Lucy finds the entrance to a dazzling and dangerous winter wonderland. (2005)(135 mins)(n)

programme.title: Bend It like Beckham
programme.desc: Giddy, crowd-pleasing romp about an English teenager whose dreams of soccer stardom clash with the wishes of her traditional Sikh family(n)

programme.title: Mamma Mia!
programme.desc: Longing to discover the identity of her true father before she exchanges her wedding vows, the daughter of a once-rebellious single mother secretly invites a trio of paternal candidates to her upcoming wedding in this feature adaptation of the beloved stage musical. Independent-minded single mother Donna (Meryl Streep) has always done her best to raise her spirited daughter, Sophie (Amanda Seyfried), while simultaneously running a successful hotel on a small Greek island, but now the time has come for this hardworking mom to finally let go. In just a few days, Sophie will be married, and Donna will stand by bittersweetly as her little girl takes flight. Of course, Donna's lifelong friends Rosie (Julie Walters) and Tanya (Christine Baranski) will both be present at the wedding, but unbeknownst to the mother, Sophie has furtively invited three very special guests of her own. When Sophie walks down the aisle on that fateful day, she wants her father to hand her off. The only problem is that Donna has never revealed the true identity of Sophie's father, leaving the resourceful future bride to narrow the list down to three potential candidates. Now, as three key figures from Donna's past return to the picturesque Mediterranean shores they all walked 20 years prior, one beautiful bride will discover the secret of her past while one lonely mother finds out that it's never too late for a little romance. Phyllida Lloyd, director of both the original London sensation as well as the hit Broadway incarnation, makes her feature directorial debut with this big-screen version of the beloved musical featuring 22 classic ABBA hits. Pierce Brosnan, Colin Firth, Stellan Skarsgård, and Dominic Cooper co-star(n)

programme.title: Driving Miss Daisy
programme.desc: A Southern matron forges a bond with her black chauffeur in the racially-divided 1960s South. Only when he is retired and she is confined to a home for the elderly do the two fully realise that they've been friends and kindred spirits all along(n)

programme.title: Making of 'War for the Planet of the Apes'
programme.desc: A look at "War for the Planet of the Apes," a 2017 thriller about an ape army's struggle against homo sapiens. The film stars Andy Serkis, Woody Harrelson and Steve Zahn, and is directed by Matt Reeves(n)

programme.title: Unforgiven
programme.desc: William Munny, a notorious killer, has settled down on a farm with his two children. His animals are sick and times are hard. When he finds out that there is $500 to be made from killing two cowboys, who deserve it, he reluctantly takes it on. He calls on his old partner Ned, who rides with him and 'The Schofield Kid', the young boy who told Munny about the money. They enter the town which is watched over by an evil sheriff called Little Bill(n)

programme.title: Term Life
programme.desc: A thief takes his estranged daughter on the lam when a job goes awry in this intense thriller. As crooks and corrupt cops close in on them, he also takes out a life-insurance policy on himself in an effort to leave something behind for his daughter(n)

programme.title: Be Cool
programme.desc: Movie mogul and former gangster Chili Palmer is itching for a new project. He decides to make his first foray into the music business - but his ambition to turn a female performer into a star leaves him with a price on his head(n)

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: After a family tragedy, a boy follows a series of clues that lead him to a mysterious orphanage on a remote Welsh island. There, he discovers a community of children with unusual abilities(n)

programme.title: The Bodyguard
programme.desc: A pop singer receives threatening notes and her manager hires a bodyguard. He ruffles the singer's feathers and most of her entourage by tightening security more than they feel is necessary. Eventually, the bodyguard and the singer start an affair and she begins to believe his precautions are necessary(n)

programme.title: The Birth of a Nation
programme.desc: This historical drama recounts a real-life slave revolt that occurred in 1831 Virginia, led by a black preacher named Nat Turner. Turner is so appalled by the horrors he sees while sermonising that he is moved to fight back(n)

programme.title: Boiler Room
programme.desc: A college dropout gets a job as a broker for a suburban investment firm, which puts him on the fast track to success, but the job might not be as legitimate as it sounds(n)

programme.title: The Legend of Tarzan
programme.desc: Years after leaving the jungle and settling down with his wife Jane in London, Tarzan returns to the Congo to act as a trade representative for England(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: 06/20/2017. Segments include a look at the dwindling popularity of bullfighting in Spain; profiles of American tennis up-and-comer Frances Tiafoe and Paralympian and Mount Everest climber Jeff Glasbrenner; a visit with a young man working to chronicle and assist surviving Negro League players(n)

programme.title: Making of 'Straight Outta Compton'
programme.desc: A look at "Straight Outta Compton," a 2015 drama that chronicles the history of the hip-hop group NWA in 1980s California. The film stars Jason Mitchell, Corey Hawkins, O'Shea Jackson Jr., Aldis Hodge and Neil Brown Jr., and is directed by F. Gary Gray(n)

programme.title: Straight Outta Compton
programme.desc: Entrenched in the racial tumult of Los Angeles in the mid-1980's, a group of aspiring rappers banded together to revolutionize the global consumption of hip-hop and popular culture. NWA was born out of racial frustration and the disadvantaged economics of their South Central neighborhood. F. Gary Gray directs this biopic about the rise to stardom for the act that earned the moniker of "The World's Most Dangerous Group", featuring Ice Cube's son O'Shea Jackson Jr. playing the role of his father, Corey Hawkins as Dr. Dre, and Jason Mitchell as the late Eazy-E(n)

programme.title: Broadcast News
programme.desc: Intelligent romantic comedy which satirises American television news. A highly-strung news producer finds herself strangely attracted to a vapid anchorman, even though she loathes everything he personifies. To make matters worse, her best friend, a talented but unphotogenic news reporter, is secretly in love with her(n)

programme.title: The League of Extraordinary Gentlemen
programme.desc: Sean Connery stars in this all-action adventure as Allan Quatermain, called out of retirement in Kenya to help the government avert a world war being fermented by master criminal The Phantom. Quatermain gathers together a top team; Dorian Gray, Captain Nemo, Mina Harker and The Invisible Man are among those recruited, each with a spectacular skill. From Venice to the wastes of Mongolia, the team face perils and death in their desperate race against time. Stephen Norrington's fantasy, set in an alternative Victorian world, is frantic fun-filled action from start to finish, with the witty script matching awesome special effects(n)

programme.title: Crimson Peak
programme.desc: A mysterious stranger woos and transports a young woman to a crumbling dwelling atop a clay mountain, where she soon learns he has many secrets in the haunted mansion that will leave her fighting for her sanity and her very life(n)

programme.title: Rush Hour 3
programme.desc: In this slick, slam-bang sequel mismatched cops head to Paris to unravel a plot by Triad gangs to assassinate a Chinese diplomat(n)

programme.title: War Dogs
programme.desc: Two down-on-their-luck pals become arms dealers, but get in over their heads when they land a $300 million contract with the U.S. government to supply weaponry to forces in Afghanistan. This raucous comedy-drama is based on true events(n)

programme.title: The Breakfast Club
programme.desc: Forced to spend a Saturday detention in school, five disparate high school kids find that they have more in common than they ever realized. Romantic comedy drama staring Emilio Estevez. (1985)(n)

programme.title: Transformers: Revenge of the Fallen
programme.desc: Sam and his girlfriend race against time to save the planet from an ancient Decepticon named The Fallen while Optimus Prime and the Autobots work with the military to eliminate the remaining Decepticons(n)

programme.title: Oz
programme.desc: The Routine. The premiere episode of HBO's Oz, directed by Darnell Martin (I Like It Like That), gives viewers an idea of the kind of graphic violence and deviant behavior they can expect from the series. Augustus Hill (Harold Perrineau), a wheelchair-bound convict, serves as the narrator, providing a dark philosophical overview to the action. He introduces many of the characters, giving their names, serial numbers, crime, and sentence while a brief flashback of the crime plays. Tobias Beecher (Lee Tergesen) is out of his element, even in the seemingly safer experimental rehabilitation unit known as "Emerald City," run by well-intentioned control freak Tim McManus (Terry Kinney). Beecher is a former attorney who has been sentenced to 15 years for vehicular manslaughter. Beecher is introduced to his sponsor, Dino Ortolani (Jon Seda), a hot-tempered thug who's connected to Oz's resident Mob boss, Nino Schibetta (Tony Musante). Every new prisoner in "Em City" gets a sponsor, who's supposed to help him adjust, but Ortolani has no use for Beecher, so when Beecher's cellmate, Simon Adebisi (Adewale Akinnouye-Agbaje), starts shaking him down, he's on his own. Vern Schillinger (J.K. Simmons) takes an interest, suggesting Beecher ask McManus for a transfer to another cell. Beecher gratefully takes Schillinger's advice, and ends up bunking with him. Then Beecher finds out that his new cellmate runs the Aryan Brotherhood. "You're mine now," Schillinger tells him. He later burns a swastika tattoo into Beecher's buttocks. Ortolani, meanwhile, has his own problems. A hood he shot, Ryan O'Reily (Dean Winters), gets sent to Oz, but Schibetta warns Ortolani against taking revenge. Ortolani also beats a gay prisoner who comes on to him. The cagey O'Reily convinces the gay man's brother, the leader of Emerald City's gangbangers, Jefferson Keane (Leon), to team up with him to arrange for Ortolani's murder(n)

programme.title: Oz
programme.desc: Conjugal Visits and Otherwise. Beecher receives a conjugal visit from his wife, but it may be his last because the governor wants to end the privilege; Glynn and Schibetta both react to the assault on Ortolani(n)

programme.title: Miss Peregrine's Home for Peculiar Children
programme.desc: After a family tragedy, a boy follows a series of clues that lead him to a mysterious orphanage on a remote Welsh island. There, he discovers a community of children with unusual abilities(n)

programme.title: Harold & Kumar Escape From Guantanamo Bay
programme.desc: The pot-smoking friends are suspected of being terrorists(n)

programme.title: HBO Comedy Half-Hour
programme.desc: Dave Attell. Dave Attell performs a set from San Francisco. Among other things, he talks about trash trucks, cable TV, and when men know they're going bald ("your conversations with your barber keep getting shorter")(n)

programme.title: I-Spy
programme.desc: Yet another classic television series from the 1960s gets a big-screen update in this action-comedy inspired by the Bill Cosby/Robert Culp vehicle I Spy. Alex Scott (Owen Wilson) is a federal intelligence agent who has been assigned to find a particularly expensive and valuable weapon which has gone missing: a special stealth fighter jet which can not only hide from radar, but also turn invisible to the human eye. Scott learns a rogue agent has sold the jet to Gundars (Malcolm McDowell), a powerful and unscrupulous underground arms dealer. After blowing his opportunity to catch Gundars in the act, Scott formulates a Plan B -- it seems Gundars is a rabid boxing fan, so in order to get inside his organization, Scott recruits Kelly Robinson (Eddie Murphy), a longtime middleweight champion whose ego nearly exceeds his talent in the ring. Robinson is excited by the prospect of a life of espionage, but Scott and Robinson's personalities are like oil and water, and matters are hardly helped by the efforts of less-than-helpful fellow agents Rachel (Famke Janssen) and Carlos (Gary Cole). This adaptation of I Spy was directed by a woman who starred in a memorable television series herself, former Hill Street Blues regular Betty Thomas, who has gone on to a successful career behind the camera(n)

programme.title: Men in Black II
programme.desc: With the scum of the universe menacing Earth again, agent Will Smith brings back Tommy Lee Jones to kick alien backside. Comic sequel. Mild fantasy violence/flashing images(n)

programme.title: The Good Guy
programme.desc: This fun-loving romantic comedy follows a young New Yorker (Alexis Bledel) as she searches for the perfect man. A Wall Street big shot (Scott Porter) seems like the real deal, until she meets his handsome coworker (Bryan Greenberg) and comes to realize love is as big of a gamble as the stock market(n)

programme.title: Rat Race
programme.desc: There's a great comic pedigree for this treasure hunting adventure. Crooked hotelier John Cleese is offering $2m free: the first to find it wins. Add a hapless sports ref, two conmen and a bemused Italian tourist for some broad comedy(n)

programme.title: Be Kind Rewind
programme.desc: After a freak accident causes all the tapes in a video store to be erased, an employee and his friend decide to make their own no-budget re-creations of various hit movies(n)

programme.title: Bridget Jones: The Edge of Reason
programme.desc: Bridget Jones ya es feliz: vive con el apuesto Mark Darcy, y ha dejado a un lado al cretino de su ex-jefe Daniel. Pero una estúpida amiga, Rebeca, viene a fastidiar su relación con Mark. Además, el trabajo le va mal y lo peor viene cuando, en un viaje a T(n)

programme.desc: A spirited Vegas showgirl goes into witness protection at a convent where she soon injects some rhythm into the uptight atmosphere(n)

programme.title: Shakespeare in Love
programme.desc: Best Picture winner is about a fictional romance between a struggling young playwright named Shakespeare and a noblewoman who longs to act, and who inspires him to write "Romeo and Juliet."(n)

programme.title: Mike and Dave Need Wedding Dates
programme.desc: Two hard-partying ladies see a viral video in which unruly brothers plead for dates for their sister's wedding in Hawaii, and decide to pose as the angels they're looking for in order to score a free trip(n)

programme.title: Be Kind Rewind
programme.desc: After a freak accident causes all the tapes in a video store to be erased, an employee and his friend decide to make their own no-budget re-creations of various hit movies(n)

programme.title: Barely Legal
programme.desc: A trio of sex-obsessed high-school losers decide to try and make their own adult film and get rich in the process, but recruiting the necessary cast proves tougher than expected(n)

programme.title: Hollywood Ending
programme.desc: A witty script and a great ensemble cast add up to one of Woody Allen's most hilarious farces. Allen wrote, directed and stars as a washed-up filmmaker who is suddenly stricken with psychosomatic blindness on the eve of his big comeback(n)

programme.title: Making of 'My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2'
programme.desc: A look at "My Big Fat Greek Wedding 2," a 2016 sequel to the 2002 hit that follows the Portokalos clan as they celebrate another momentous walk down the aisle. The film stars Nia Vardalos, John Corbett, Lainie Kazan and Michael Constantine, and is directed by Kirk Jones(n)

programme.title: Protocol
programme.desc: Goldie Hawn is the ditzy Washington waitress (dressed as an emu) who saves a Middle Eastern worthy and wins a job on Capitol Hill. A sunny yarn from veteran comedy director Herbert Ross(n)

programme.title: The Winning Season
programme.desc: A man (Sam Rockwell) attempts to pull his life together by teaching his daughter's (Emma Roberts) high-school basketball team in this indie comedy by Grace Is Gone writer/director James C. Strouse. Rob Corddry co-stars in this Gigi/Plum Pictures production(n)

programme.title: Central Intelligence
programme.desc: A mild-mannered accountant runs into an old high-school classmate, an overweight loser-turned-muscular CIA agent, and ends up helping him with a crucial mission involving the hacking of U.S. spy satellites(n)

programme.title: Do the Right Thing
programme.desc: A local black community is unhappy that their community is effectively being run by whites. As the heat rises on a hot summer's day in Brooklyn, so the racial tension, which has so far lay dormant under the surface, begins to rise(n)

programme.title: Serendipity
programme.desc: A couple reunite years after the night they first met, fell in love, and separated, convinced that one day they'd end up together(n)

programme.title: The Witches of Eastwick
programme.desc: Susan Sarandon, Michelle Pfeiffer and Cher star in this Oscar nominated comedy as three bored, single women who dream of a man that can satisfy their desires. But when a filthy rich, mysterious man arrives in their lives, things start to get interesting(n)

programme.title: Absolutely Fabulous: The Movie
programme.desc: In this hysterical big-screen continuation of the popular British sitcom, hard-living ladies Edina and Patsy flee to the French Riviera after they accidentally cause the death of a celebrity at a posh party(n)

programme.title: Airheads

programme.desc: This light-hearted comedy depicts a typical summer camp, but with a special twist: this camp was designed by the campers themselves! "Mud" Himmel is a nerd. That Gaby is going again to fat camp weighs heavily upon her mind. None of them are thrilled with their camp prospects and it is rebellious Mud who suggest that they create their own, secret camp. Enter Dennis Van Welker, their crazy high school drama instructor. He offers to join the conspiracy and act as their camp counselor. Just as it looks as if the four misfits are going to have a really great summer together, two dozen of their peers find out about the camp and decide to come along. programme.title: Space Chimps
programme.desc: In Kirk demicco's animated film three supersonic simian spacemen take to the cosmos to find a missing probe, and encounter a whole world of trouble along the way. Ham III, grandson of the first chimp in space, is a wise-cracking smart aleck who makes a living being fired from a cannon. When the Infinity Space Probe goes missing, Ham joins a mission to find it. Although he has been recruited as a PR stunt, his fellow Space Chimps are highly trained experts Luna and Titan. When the three crash-land on the planet Malgor, they find a race of aliens who are being oppressed by the tyrannical Zartog, who is using the probe for his own nefarious ends. It falls to the feckless Ham to save the day, using his circus skills to help liberate the aliens, recover the probe, get the girl, and secure passage home. This is great fare for all the family, with plenty of deadpan asides to keep grown-ups entertained. The cast also includes Stanley Tucci, and two names Glee devotees will recognise Jane Lynch and Kristin Chenoweth(n)

programme.title: Eight Below
programme.desc: Eight brave sled dogs search for the master who is looking for a way to rescue them in this adventure drama. An American geologist (Bruce Greenwood) flies to Antarctica to participate in a project at the United States Research Base, where he teams up with arctic guide Jerry Shepard (Paul Walker) and his best friend, Cooper (Jason Biggs). The scientist soon discovers that Shepard also has eight other valuable friends -- a pack of sled dogs he's worked with for years, who have rescued him from a number of tight spots. As the three men explore a frozen mountain region, an unexpected accident coupled with a massive storm front forces them to fly to safety, leaving the dogs behind. Shepard is determined to rescue his canine friends, but he has to wait until the weather will allow him to travel back to the mountain, while the dogs struggle against the elements to survive as they attempt to make their way back home. Eight Below was inspired by a true story involving Japanese researchers exploring the Antarctic in 1957; the story was made into the film Nankyoku Monogatari(n)

programme.title: Formula 51
programme.desc: First-time screenwriter Stelios Pavlou enjoyed a major success with this script that he wrote while working in an English liquor store by sending it to actor Samuel L. Jackson, who signed on for one of the lead roles. Jackson is Elmo McElroy, a kilt-wearing, golf club-wielding Los Angeles native who has invented an illegal drug formula that he hopes will provide him with a last major score of 20 million dollars before he retires from a life of crime. He travels to Liverpool, England, where he hopes to find a buyer for his creation among the denizens of the city's rave scene, but his plans go awry when those who are in on the deal start turning up dead. Elmo's only protector is a chain-smoking, Yank-hating local hood named Felix De Souza (Robert Carlyle), who reluctantly partners with the violence-prone American to finish the deal and cash in, sparking a gang war between Elmo's vengeful one-time employer, The Lizard (Meat Loaf); Felix's boss, Durant (Ricky Tomlinson); crooked cop Virgil Kane (Sean Pertwee); a beautiful assassin, who also happens to be Felix's ex-girlfriend (Emily Mortimer); and an offbeat, yoga-practicing nightclub owner and mobster named Iki (Rhys Ifans). For its U.S. release, the title of The 51st State was changed to Formula 51(n)

programme.title: Bullet to the Head
programme.desc: A cop and a killer forge a shaky partnership to find out who killed their partners in this throwback buddy action flick starring Sylvester Stallone, and directed by vet Walter Hill. Battle-scarred New Orleans hitman James Bonomo (Stallone) and his longtime partner Louis (Jon Seda) have just executed their latest hit, a cop named Hank Greely (Holt McCallany) when Louis is killed by hulking enforcer Keegan (Jason Momoa) before they can get paid. In the wake of a failed attempt on Bonomo's life as well, Keegan flees the scene, but not before his intended target gets a good look at his face. Meanwhile, Korean NYPD cop Taylor Kwon (Sung Kang) shows up in town determined to find out who killed Greely, his former partner. When Kwon tracks Bonomo down to find out who hired him, both realize that their best hope for catching their respective partners' killers is to team up. Before long, their trail of clues has led them to sleazy lawyer Marcus Baptiste (Christian Slater), who is currently caught up in some shady business dealings with the mysterious and powerful Robert Nkomo Morel (Adewale Akinnuoye-Agbaje) that could implicate some serious power players in Washington, D.C. Now each new move that Bonomo and Kwon make could be their last, and as the cop does his best to stay on the right side of the law, the killer uses the only tactics he knows to get results. But even if they manage to get their man, that doesn't change the fact that they'll have to deal with one another once they've taken down their target(n)

programme.title: The Limey
programme.desc: Terence Stamp stars in this this tense thriller as a hardened criminal whose release from jail prompts him to look for his daughter's murderer. He contacts her much-older boyfriend (Peter Fonda), and discovers the man has a few skeletons in his closet. Lesley Ann Warren, Luis Guzman, Barry Newman. Steven Soderbergh directed(n)

programme.title: The Mothman Prophecies

He teams up with local cop Connie Parker and discovers that frightened townsfolk have seen a shadowy 'mothman' creature which closely resembles pictures his wife drew just before her death. As Klein struggles to find rational solutions to irrational events, and is disturbed by visions of his dead wife, the threat of impending disaster steadily grows(n)

programme.title: Real Sports With Bryant Gumbel
programme.desc: 06/20/2017. Segments include a look at the dwindling popularity of bullfighting in Spain; profiles of American tennis up-and-comer Frances Tiafoe and Paralympian and Mount Everest climber Jeff Glasbrenner; a visit with a young man working to chronicle and assist surviving Negro League players(n)

programme.title: Nights in Rodanthe
programme.desc: Escaping a broken marriage, Adrienne Willis travels to the North Carolina town of Rodanthe where a chance meeting with troubled doctor Paul Flanner leads to a life- changing love affair(n)

programme.title: Le Divorce
programme.desc: Based on the 1997 National Book Award-nominated novel of the same name by Diane Johnson (co-writer of the script for Stanley Kubrick's The Shining), Le Divorce is a romantic comedy from director James Ivory. Revisiting the "Americans in France" theme that Ivory explored in 1998's A Soldier's Daughter Never Cries, the film stars Kate Hudson as Isabel Walker. When she receives word that her pregnant poetess sister Roxy (Naomi Watts) has been left by her philandering French husband, artist Charles-Henri de Persand (Melvil Poupaud), Isabel offers her help and moral support. As the depressive Roxy struggles with the separation proceedings -- which include the rights to ownership of a work of art that's a family heirloom -- Isabel takes a job with author Olivia Pace and has a fling with the bohemian Yves (Romain Duris). But things get complicated when the younger, more impudent sister decides instead to pursue Charles' uncle, the snooty, married diplomat Edgar (Thierry Lhermitte), and when a mysterious man (Matthew Modine) starts stalking Roxy. Eventually, the rest of the plucky Walker clan has to come to the aid of the siblings. Stockard Channing and Sam Waterston co-star(n)

Then, when the job is finished, he unwinds in a gay bar and is attacked by a homophobic thug - losing his wallet in the process. Not wanting police involvement, he goes home with no money, but eventually comes clean about a sexual encounter with a fellow worker and his world collapses around him. Vincent Regan and Julia Ford star, with Will Mellor.(n)

However, even after a confession is secured, Joe remains baffled as to the motive, and Kate struggles to remain professional - jeopardising her career and leaving Jake to prosecute the case alone. Guest starring Haydn Gwynne.(n)

Tony remains sceptical throughout - until Alex and her son become the killer's next targets. Thriller, starring Robson Green and Simone Lahbib.(n)

Crime drama, starring Helen Mirren, with James Laurenson and Jill Baker.(n)

Meanwhile, one of the department store's most loyal employees is caught stealing, a formidable new head of fashion arrives and Rose reveals her true identity to Roddy.(n)

programme.title: Long Lost Family
programme.desc: Patricia Hart grew up in the colliery village of Moorends in South Yorkshire, where her father was a miner. Shortly after being demobbed from the Women's Royal Army Corps, she discovered she was pregnant, and with no support from her boyfriend, made the decision to give up her baby for adoption. Now, after several health scares, she fears time is running out to find her daughter. Army reservist John Farrell, from Bootle in Merseyside, was a teenager when he learnt the man he had called dad all his life was not in fact his father. At the time, anger prevented him from wanting to know more, but now, as a parent himself, his need to know his birth father has grown. Presented by Davina McCall and Nicky Campbell.(n)

However, the sleuthing spinster is not convinced. Agatha Christie mystery, with Angela Lansbury, Elizabeth Taylor, Kim Novak and Rock Hudson.(n)

programme.desc: As the sole witness to a dying man's last words, Bobby Attfield is determined to solve the riddle they present, and forms an unlikely alliance with socialite Frankie Derwent and visiting family friend Miss Marple to help him on his quest. A trail of clues leads them to Castle Savage, where they uncover a hotbed of stifled emotion, treachery and deceit among its strange inhabitants. Murder mystery, starring Julia McKenzie, with a supporting cast that includes Sean Biggerstaff, Samantha Bond, Richard Briers, Rafe Spall, Warren Clarke, Mark Williams, Georgia Moffett, Helen Lederer and Rik Mayall.(n)

programme.title: Agatha Christie's Marple
