The manner of her death creates a sensation in the tense village community of Little Ambrose, but although the woman's husband confesses to the crime, Miss Marple uncovers new evidence that could affect the court hearing's outcome and races to halt proceedings before the wrong person is convicted. Starring Julia McKenzie, with Toby Stephens, Sharon Small, Patrick Baladi, Caroline Catz, Claire Rushbrook and Donald Sinden.(n)

His wife, her lover and a former business associate are all possible suspects, but the case takes a surprising turn when the victim's sister receives a gruesome delivery. She's on the jury for the trial of a drug dealer and murderer who Ronnie has been trying to nail for years, and the threat to her points to jury tampering, so Jake and Kate have to take a dramatic approach to win the case. When the detective suffers a personal loss, he's forced to navigate a complex murder case while grieving. A young Estonian woman has been found dead, with the evidence suggesting she was buried alive. Piecing together her movements, the team uncovers a dark world of prostitution and drugs, and investigates her connection to a single father, his autistic son, and a family who seem to have silenced the town.(n)

As the investigation into Katrin's murder continues, the body of an older man who died of natural causes is found buried near her grave, and when Banks suspects Jason McCready abducted missing Annika, he uncovers a shocking secret. Joe is convinced the case is a poaching war gone wrong, but for Vera, the truth is never that straightforward. Delving into the victim's story, she unearths a sad childhood in the country and a troubled life in the city, scraping by as a novelist. Chief Revenue investigator Owen Preece (guest star Robert Glenister) reveals John's business manager Mark Donovan has been running an alcohol scam through their haulage firm and the deceased had agreed to offer information in exchange for immunity from prosecution. programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Maggie and Ian Dickson, who run Glenferndale B&B near Edinburgh, hope to be in with a chance of winning the title of best establishment as another round of the competition gets under way. However, two guests feel things are too homely, a spelling mistake on the breakfast menu is spotted, and the mood is not helped when the hosts have a bust-up.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Kristin Grantham hosts at Pitlessie House near the historic town of St Andrews in Fife, where the owner's slipper policy raises some eyebrows and two guests are alarmed by a stained mattress in their room. The afternoon's bagpiping competition is a hit, but cultural differences flare up over dinner and the proprietor's continental breakfast does not achieve the score she hoped for.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Mother-and-daughter team Eileen and Jannika Hopeakoski invite guests to their B&B Sea-La-Vie in Southsea, Portsmouth, for the third visit of the week, and while the guests think the stylish rooms are a fine vintage, host Eileen gets hot under the collar after discovering Ian and Maggie have been trying to strip back the mattress cover.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Craig and Marie Harris welcome their guests to the Peaks Inn in Derbyshire, but a few of the guests are far from impressed upon arrival. When the hosts reveal ferret racing is their chosen activity, a joke causes Eileen to lose her temper, so Ian and Maggie decide to stage a silent protest.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The hoteliers meet one last time for feedback, during which they will discover how much their rivals thought their service was worth, and which of them was the most successful. Maggie and Ian Dickson decide to tackle complaints from Eileen and Jannika Hopeakoski head-on, while Craig and Marie Harris prepare for a fight after telling German competitor Kristin Grantham her venue and welcome lacked some much-needed warmth.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Retired teacher Theresa Robinson and her GP husband Alan are planning to relocate from Norfolk to Spain's Costa Brava. The couple have a budget of £250,000, and Sara Damergi takes them to view five potential homes.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Steve Cross has had a lifelong dream of living abroad and has finally met the love of his life, Sue, to share it with. With help from presenter Sara Damergi, they're determined to relocate to Aude in the south of France.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.sub-title: Kew Gardens, London: Looking for the White House.
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team visit the site of a forgotten palace built for George III at Kew Gardens in west London. The kitchen block is the only visible evidence that remains, so the immaculate lawns are ripped up in a search for the foundations.(n)

programme.title: Time Team
programme.desc: Tony Robinson and the team discover an unusual stone-covered grave as they race against the clock to excavate a Bronze Age cemetery in Fife, before land developers start work on the area.(n)

programme.title: Car SOS
programme.desc: Tim Shaw and Fuzz Townshend travel to Essex, where they rescue a 1974 Chevrolet Corvette Stingray that has been off the road for years. However, they soon discover it may be a bigger job than they anticipated when they get the iconic US vehicle back to the workshop.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: The odds are stacked against Noel Fitzpatrick and his team as a golden retriever puppy with horrific facial injuries is brought into the practice after being attacked by another dog. Plus, a man drives all the way from Switzerland in the hope of a successful treatment for a Chihuahua, and a woman brings in her Hungarian vizsla, which has a bone and cartilage disorder.(n)

programme.title: The Supervet
programme.desc: A Staffordshire bull terrier puppy called Rex receives treatment for a badly deformed elbow, and the team carry out a complicated procedure to realign the bones. Meanwhile, a cross-breed called Piggy with spinal problems leaves its family facing a difficult decision, and Noel devises an unorthodox cure for a stray cat with a badly fractured leg.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of Simon and Jill Bennett as they try to restore two timber-framed barns in Suffolk. The couple found out that one of the buildings is among the smallest surviving medieval guildhalls in the country, and while Kevin advises them to conserve it in its present state, Simon is determined to restore it to its former glory.(n)

programme.title: Dicte - Crime Reporter
programme.desc: New series. Part one of two. The reporter is contacted by her estranged father, who wants to tell her something important, and they arrange to meet. When a young woman is found murdered in a nearby hotel room, Dicte and Wagner's investigation into her fate leads them to the prostitution business controlled by wealthy Carl Ferdinand Poulsen. All the evidence points towards an extensive human trafficking ring, but can a mysterious woman named Grace lead the pair to the killer? Meanwhile, Dicte and Bo meet Rose's new boyfriend. Crime drama, starring Iben Hjejle, Lars Brygmann, Laerke Winther, Lars Ranthe, Dar Salim and Emilie Claudius Kruse. In Danish.(n)

programme.title: 24 Hours in A&E
programme.desc: Patients arriving at King's College Hospital in London include 26-year-old Nicholas, whose jaw has been fractured and dislocated in an unprovoked attack, and Tyrell, 17, who needs to have a blackened toenail removed following a football injury. Meanwhile, Ho has brought his grandmother Amoui to the ward after finding her collapsed in her flat.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef heads to Babylon in New York, where the peace of Long Island is regularly shattered by the volatile Pellegrino family, proprietors of Peter's Italian Restaurant. Gordon finds owner Tina's work to save the eatery from oblivion is frequently ruined by the behaviour of her brother, a tyrannical front-of-house manager whose violent temper constantly undermines staff morale.(n)

programme.title: Ramsay's Kitchen Nightmares USA
programme.desc: The chef tries to reverse the fortunes of the Mixing Bowl diner in Bellmore, New York, where a talented cook's work is being undone by the manager's marketing plans - putting the finances in dire straits.(n)

programme.title: Grand Designs
programme.desc: Kevin McCloud follows the progress of Simon and Jill Bennett as they try to restore two timber-framed barns in Suffolk. The couple found out that one of the buildings is among the smallest surviving medieval guildhalls in the country, and while Kevin advises them to conserve it in its present state, Simon is determined to restore it to its former glory.(n)

programme.title: 8 Out of 10 Cats Uncut
programme.desc: Claudia Winkleman, Kate Humble, David O'Doherty and Nick Helm join regular team captains Jon Richardson and Sean Lock on an extended edition of the irreverent panel show, hosted by Jimmy Carr. The teams answer questions based on opinion polls carried out around the country to see who best understands what is going on in Britain today.(n)

programme.title: Food Unwrapped
programme.desc: Jimmy Doherty visits southern Italy to find out where the bergamot flavour in Earl Grey tea comes from, before meeting a man who invented a method of making tea using an aerosol. Matt Tebbutt finds out why pork scratchings aren't made from British pigs and Kate Quilton is in a factory in California to uncover the secrets of jelly beans.(n)

programme.title: Great Canal Journeys
programme.desc: Timothy West and Prunella Scales visit the Burgundy region of France, where they travel along the Canal du Nivernais, which passes through towns and villages steeped in history. The duo also visit the market town of Chablis to help with the annual grape harvest and the medieval city of Auxerre before reflecting on what the journey has meant to them as a married couple.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Mother and daughter Retini and Jess Dunleavy from Berkshire seek help in their search for a property that can be used as a retirement and holiday home in the Languedoc region of south-west France.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi helps Lucie and Noel Benn from Cambridgeshire search for a renovation project in the Aude Valley, south-west France.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Karen and Keith Wilding and their four children plan to relocate to France, so presenter Sara Damergi helps the pair search for suitable properties in Poitou-Charentes. With a maximum budget of £70,000, they view an 18th-century property, two adjoining cottages with 11 rooms between them, a historic mill, a gatekeeper's home and a restored farmhouse.(n)

programme.title: A Place in the Sun: Summer Sun
programme.desc: Sara Damergi heads to the south-west of France to help Swansea couple Rob Morris and Gaynor Carman find a property in Limousin with their £65,000 budget, but can she locate the bargain home they are looking for?.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Marlon Williams hosts the first party in Oxford, and hopes his love-island-themed evening will be enough to win him the £1,000 prize at the end of the week. However, after a shambolic start to proceedings, the night ends with the smashing of plates.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Inventor Richard Berrecloth hosts the second dinner party in Oxford, and hopes to impress his guests with home-made food and an unusual form of entertainment. However, Heidi Kelloway and Marlon Williams appear to be more interested in each other than their host's hospitality - while another diner seems rather too keen on sampling the wine.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Mother-of-three Victoria Collett hosts the third dinner party in Oxford and begins the day with a hangover and a few culinary disasters. It is not long before her guests start grumbling and Richard Berrecloth criticises her seafood starter, so she pins her hopes on the Caribbean curry being a success.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Dog trainer James Hearle hosts the fourth dinner party in Oxford, but his four-legged friends threaten to turn the evening into a mess. Tempers also rise between the guests as culinary critic Richard Berrecloth continues shocking the group with his brutal honesty.(n)

programme.title: Come Dine with Me
programme.desc: Heidi Kelloway hosts the final dinner party in Oxford, determined to lighten the mood of the other diners. However, the evening turns sour when the diners confront the overly critical Richard Berrecloth about his frank comments, before the winner of the £1,000 prize is announced.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The competition heads to Anglesey, where best pals Richard Tuke and Susan Hatch hope to show that Blackthorn Farm B&B, which they own, is better than any of their guests' establishments. However, they find that their close friendship is scrutinised even more than their property.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The White Swan Hotel in Yeadon, West Yorkshire, is the second stop of the competition, and owners Graham and Barbara Yellow hope their basic facilities and affordable prices will please their guests. Spiritual couple Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor get good vibes from their room, Rachel Lonergan views the hosts in a new light and breakfast is well received by the contestants, despite having to pay a supplement fee.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Vegetarians Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor host at the Old Mill House B&B in Bridport, Dorset, and both come under attack at dinner when Malcolm voices his opinions on meat eating. In the morning, a meditation session gets a mixed response, and most of the guests are left cold by the vegetarian buffet breakfast.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: Rachel and Dan Lonergan welcome their guests to the Brighton Inn, East Sussex, where they hope to offer a luxury, boutique experience. Malcolm and Fiona Piers-Taylor give their room a thorough inspection, before the groups learns the art of building a human pyramid in the afternoon's activity. At breakfast, they discover a lack of vegetarian alternatives, and the hosts suspect game-playing when they are shocked by some negative feedback.(n)

programme.title: Four in a Bed
programme.desc: The B&B owners come together to confront their rivals and find out how much they have been paid. Richard and Susan are keen to tackle the bathroom issues of Barbara and Graham, who bask in the comments from Malcolm and Fiona. The Old Mill House proprietors defend their vegetarian breakfast routine, but serve up snobby feedback to Rachel and Dan from the Brighton Inn.(n)

programme.title: The Yorkshire Dales and the Lakes
programme.desc: New series. Cameras follow people who live and work in the national parks, beginning with the residents of Bleak Bank Farm in the Dales.(n)

programme.title: The Great British Skinny Dip
programme.desc: Cameras follow Andrew Welch, marketing director for British Naturism, as he attempts to attract support for a UK-wide series of nude swims over one weekend in September. The aim is to get young people to give nakedness a go in its most accessible form, and this programme follows Andrew over six busy months, including meetings with other members of this very private community.(n)

programme.title: The Naked Village
programme.desc: Documentary following the residents of Spielplatz in the village of Bricket Wood, Hertfordshire, as they go about their everyday lives naked. The resort was founded in 1929 by a family of naturists, and is now home to a mix of old and new people. However, it is under threat from property developers and they continue to suffer an ageing population and crumbling facilities, but the community plans to host various summer events in the hope of attracting new people and investment.(n)

programme.title: My Daughter the Teenage Nudist
programme.desc: Documentary following Mollie and Alex, who are part of a growing band of teenagers and twentysomethings who embrace the concept of public nudity away from designated places. Their aim is to normalise naturism and question the media's apparent obsession with perfect bodies. The programme asks why this lifestyle is gaining in popularity and finds out what parents think about their offspring revealing all in the most public of places.(n)

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell
programme.desc: Yin and Yang. Why is one guy always happy, while another is always pissed off? Kevin considers yard man Samy, a 40-year-old immigrant from Fiji, to be his assistant. When Kevin buys a video camera to film wrecks, his new hobby starts to get in the way of his current job. A head-on collision between two semis has the entire crew battling to clear the charred wreckage and get the road open. While Kevin captures the action on tape, Samy does most of the heavy lifting, earning him a bottle of scotch and Jamie's praise. That night, Samy, who sleeps in Jamie's office during the week, reveals that his hard work is all for his beloved wife and kids. Meanwhile, Kevin, reviewing his footage at home, reveals that his video hobby started with his father, who worked in TV. When Kevin announced that he wanted to be a truck driver, they stopped speaking, and Kevin hasn't seen his father in over 20 years. Kevin considers Jamie to be his adopted father. The next day, a harrowing drive up the Coq in dangerous avalanche conditions leaves Kevin questioning why they do this for a living(n)

programme.title: Highway Thru Hell

programme.title: The Invaders
programme.desc: Pigzilla. Australia is being over-run by an invader. At as many as twenty-three million strong, feral pigs have already caused untold damage, and further destruction is inevitable if they're not stopped. Highly intelligent, hardy, and adaptable feral pigs are thriving in the land down-under. Here, they're endangering native species, spreading disease, destroying farmland, and even attacking people. Deliberately introduced by humans centuries ago, now it's up to humans to keep their populations in check. But that's easier said than done. So scientists and citizens are now resorting to a range of methods to defend their country. Join Nat Geo WILD as we tag along with the people who are defending Australia from this dangerous invader(n)

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: I, Done. In the conclusion of Fresh Prince of Bel-Air's series finale, Will (Will Smith) may not have anyplace to stay in Bel-Air when the Banks mansion is put up for sale and the rest of the household leaves town to pursue their separate dreams. "Stuck on the soft side of life", Will hasn't made any plans for the future--and now that the time has come to say goodbye, he can't. Among the prospective buyers of the Banks home are Diff'rent Strokes regulars Arnold (Gary Coleman) and Mr. Drummond (Conrad Bain, and George and Louise Jefferson (Sherman Hemsley, Isabel Sanford), with maid Florence (Marla Gibbs) along for the ride! Don't miss the classic "turning off the lights one last time" closing gag!(n)

programme.desc: A lost human infant is discovered during an Ice Age 20,000 years ago, and an unlikely trio of misfits team up to return him to his tribe. programme.title: Full House
programme.desc: Danny's Very First Date. After several months of hemming and hawing, Danny (Bob Saget) decides to go on his first date since becoming a widower. The lucky girl is Linda (Karen Kopkins), the adult leader of Stephanie's Honeybee troop. But when his daughters express displeasure over Danny's upcoming date, he decides to call it off--leading to one of the series' many "very special moments." Elsewhere, Jesse (John Stamos) and Joey (David Coulier) demonstrate their utter lack of construction skills when they try to build a toy slide for baby Michelle(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Morning After
programme.desc: The One with the Morning After. In the second half of a two-part story, Ross (David Schwimmer) has spent the night with Chloe (Angela Featherstone), the girl from the Xerox store with the belly-button ring. When Rachel (Jennifer Aniston) finds out, a battle royal ensues. The other friends would like to stay out of the fracas, but they are literally trapped into eavesdropping. And in another development, a "painless" leg-waxing kit doesn't entirely live up to its advertising(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Hypnosis Tape
programme.desc: The One with the Hypnosis Tape. Phoebe is upset when her 18-year-old half-brother, Frank Jr. (Giovanni Ribisi), wants to marry his attractive home economics teacher, who is more than 25 years his senior. Monica receives a tip from an admirer worth a small fortune, and a hypnosis tape that's meant to help Chandler give up smoking has a strange effect on him(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One with the Tiny T-Shirt
programme.desc: The One with the Tiny T-Shirt. Rachel goes on her first date after splitting from Ross(n)

programme.title: Friends

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: I, Done. Uncle Phil celebrates his 50th birthday while the gang gathers round to reminisce about the early days(n)

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: I, Done. In the conclusion of Fresh Prince of Bel-Air's series finale, Will (Will Smith) may not have anyplace to stay in Bel-Air when the Banks mansion is put up for sale and the rest of the household leaves town to pursue their separate dreams. "Stuck on the soft side of life", Will hasn't made any plans for the future--and now that the time has come to say goodbye, he can't. Among the prospective buyers of the Banks home are Diff'rent Strokes regulars Arnold (Gary Coleman) and Mr. Drummond (Conrad Bain, and George and Louise Jefferson (Sherman Hemsley, Isabel Sanford), with maid Florence (Marla Gibbs) along for the ride! Don't miss the classic "turning off the lights one last time" closing gag!(n)

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: Bang the Drum Ashley. Ashley's father wants her to continue with her violin lessons, but Will has other ideas(n)

programme.title: The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air
programme.desc: Clubba Hubba. While paying his first visit to the Banks' country club, Will (Will Smith) falls for attractive Mimi Mumford (Victoria Rowell), who happens to be the daughter of a snobbish--and rather menacing--physician (played by Richard Roundtree) of "Shaft" fame). Terrified of "Dr. No", Will turns to cousin Carlton (Alfonso Ribeiro) for advice on how to win over the girl's dad. Predictably, Will is not cut out to be a preppie--but this hardly matters to Mimi, who has a fondness for "street guys"(n)

programme.title: George Lopez
programme.desc: It's a Cliffhanger, by George. Ernie tells George that the factory is moving to Mexico and that they'll both be out of jobs; Benny flees when she learns that the police want to question her about a robbery; a nauseated Angie awaits the results of a home-pregnancy test; Carmen is afraid to open her final college letter after three rejections; Max is tempted by beer; and Vic prepares to propose to a young woman he barely knows(n)

programme.title: George Lopez
programme.desc: George's Mom Faces Hard Tambien. Angie tells George she's pregnant, and Benny's off to jail after she's arrested as an accessory to the convenience-store robbery. So George has to find a lawyer (Adam West). And that won't be his only expense: Carmen got accepted into college. Meanwhile, Vic announces that he's getting married again, to a 27-year-old. Judge Alvarez: Marilyn Milian(n)

programme.title: Home and Away

programme.desc: Stylist Gok Wan gives more women a new look as the live fashion show concludes, showing them how to feel confident this summer - whatever their size and shape. Former model Katie Piper presents her step-by-step female guide to beauty maintenance, from waxing to tanning, and there are also tips on how to dress for an evening out in the warm weather. Last in the series.(n)

programme.title: Friends
programme.sub-title: The One on the Last Night.
programme.desc: Joey and Chandler celebrate their last night as flatmates, and Ross claims he is too busy babysitting to help Monica as she frantically tries to arrange Rachel's packing before the removal firm arrives. Comedy, starring Matt LeBlanc and Matthew Perry.(n)

programme.title: Dr Seuss' The Lorax
programme.desc: A boy leaves his urban home in search of a real tree, and meets the reclusive industrialist who first created the city. The hermit tells the story of a grumpy forest creature who tried to stop him destroying the trees, and inspires the youngster to undo the damage that has been done. Animated fantasy based on the children's book, with the voices of Danny DeVito, Zac Efron and Ed Helms.(n)

programme.title: Saturday Game Live
programme.desc: Clare v Mayo (Throw-in 5.00pm). Evanne Ni Chuilinn presents coverage of the All-Ireland Senior Football Championship Round 3A qualifier from Cusack Park.(n)

programme.title: David Attenborough Meets President Obama
programme.desc: Another chance to see Barack Obama's conversation, recorded in May 2015, with renowned naturalist and film-maker David Attenborough. In a twist on usual convention, the US President took the role of interviewer, quizzing Attenborough about his thoughts on the future of the planet, their shared passion for nature, and potential ways to protect the environment. Also includes behind-the-scenes footage from Sir David's latest project on the Great Barrier Reef, as well as highlights from throughout the veteran broadcaster's career.(n)

programme.title: Attenborough & the Giant Dinosaur
programme.desc: The story of how more than 220 dinosaur bones were found in the Argentinean desert, which were found to have come from a previously undiscovered species, which is the largest land dwelling animal known to have existed. David Attenborough visits the archaeological dig and a laboratory where the remains are being cleaned and analysed with lead scientist Dr Diego Pol and evolutionary biologist Ben Garrod, and meets animators, model-makers, paleontologists and anatomy experts who are working to reconstruct what the 37 metre-long creature would have looked like.(n)

programme.title: Natural World
programme.desc: Meet the big birds, a feathered family who've never flown a day in their lives. From ostriches to kiwis, these bizarre birds appear to be nature's greatest novelty act. How they came to be and how they continue to survive is a fascinating tale that has long captivated David Attenborough. In this programme, he tells a story of dedicated dads, enormous eggs and a serious need for speed. And far from being the court jesters of the animal world, these flightless curiosities once nearly ruled the planet.(n)

programme.title: Attenborough at 90
programme.desc: Kirsty Young talks to David Attenborough about his life and career, discussing his travels around the world and most memorable encounters with wildlife. The programme features footage from his many natural history programmes, including scenes where unusual animal behaviour was caught on camera for the first time, and celebrates his influence on generations of viewers' understanding of the natural world. Featuring contributions from friends and colleagues including Michael Palin and Chris Packham.(n)

programme.title: Live at the Apollo

Period comedy drama, starring Romain Duris, Fabrice Luchini and Laura Morante. In French.(n)

programme.title: Futurama
programme.desc: Bender begins dating the Planet Express ship, but soon grows bored and decides to dump her - just when she is flying the crew away from a furious Omicronian death fleet. programme.desc: Documentary following members of the New Zealand highway patrol as they witness some of the best and worst behaviour on the nation's motorways. programme.title: The Guest Wing

programme.desc: In this edition the actor explores the luxury hotels of Hong Kong. programme.title: Fish Town

Powerboat instructor Mike Weatherbee tries to enforce the laws of the sea, carpet-cleaner Dave Satchwill prepares to lead the town's popular ghost tour, and lone fisherman Dave Brown reveals his unusual methods.(n)

programme.desc: August arrives and the fishermen of Brixham spend time ashore with their families as their boats are repaired - but summer proves costly for Jan, who loses £1,000 for every day his vessel is out of action. Apprentice deckhand Logan has to decide whether a life at sea is the right choice for him and his family, and seafood seller Jenny receives a surprise on her 65th birthday.(n)

programme.desc: Documentary following stately home owners who hire out their estates to earn extra income, and the clients who pay to use their properties for functions including stag parties, weddings and hunting trips. The programme explores how the reality of life in Britain's grand houses is often less glamorous than it appears, as proprietors struggle to maintain crumbling buildings and pay utility bills, and examines the modern-day divide between domestic staff and their employers. Featuring life at Chillingham Castle, Maunsel House, Carlton Towers and Muncaster Castle.(n)

programme.title: NFL: America's Game
programme.desc: The story of San Francisco 49ers' 1988 Super Bowl success over Cincinnati Bengals at the Joe Robbie Stadium in Miami, Florida. This game is remembered for the 49ers' winning drive in the last few minutes of the game when, trailing 16-13 and with the ball on their own eight-yard line, quarterback Joe Montana led his team down the field and threw the winning touchdown pass with seconds to spare.(n)

programme.title: NFL: America's Game
programme.desc: A look back at San Francisco 49ers' 1989 Super Bowl triumph over Denver Broncos at the Superdome in New Orleans, Louisiana, which saw them become the first team since the Pittsburgh Steelers of 1978 and 1979 to win back-to-back Super Bowls.(n)
